Reviews.Title: “It is what it is, average. Shame!”
Reviews.Author: TUC10
Reviews.Content: An excellent location for seeing the sites of Berlin but we were disappointed by the hotel. The room, even though we stayed in a junior suite was lacking in the basics ie iPod dock, free English speaking TV channels, effective air-con and was not as clean as it should have been. Major annoyances: House keeping, on check-in we had to wait until 15:30hrs for the room and on the Saturday our room wasn't cleaned until 19:00hrs! House music at breakfast, I mean come on, is boom boom boom really necessary? The overall dirtyness of the spa area, the hot tub, hmmm, cold and the sauna too small. We couldn't get a wifi signal in our room (3rd floor) but it was free, as it should be as the hotel is not cheap. On the plus side, the staff, very welcoming and friendly. Overall the lack of attention to detail made for a rather average experience.

Reviews.Title: “too dark and not very practical”
Reviews.Author: kn0kki
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel for people who like form over function. A few examples: The first morning there was a lot of noise in the corrider from cleaning or service persons (hoovering?!). The shower head was so big (or the cabin so small), that it was impossible to find a place out of the shower. The light buttons were dark, like the walls and the rest of the interior, so it was hard to find the switches. Furthermore, there was no indication on or logic behind the switches. So each time, you had to find the switches again and try them all to see which was the right one. The space between the foot end of the bed and the (round!) wall would have been barely enough to pass inattentively without the TV; with the mounted flat screen you really had to pay attention when passing. WiFi was free, but then the hassle with the log-on screen, usernames and passwords. Only valid for 24 hours and we stayed 3 nights. Why not just a password?! Several times the cleaners were already close too being in our room, when we were still in bed. The red wine I took from the mini bar was not replaced by a new one. A glass had a crack and they had me get a new one myself. There were just too many small and less small things, which made this hotel less enjoyable than expected,

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: elbaron13
Reviews.Content: It is a Hetero friendly Hotel because officially it is a gay Hotel - when we where there, me and my wife we wanted to experience that kind of hotel and 4 gay friends from Brazil choose that hotel too. Service is great, price was okay, we book trough a internet hotel booking system - we payed for breakfast at the hotel but the choice is not so great, most guest just walk over the street to a near coffee shop - Internet is free but you have to ask for a code every 24 hour - they have 2 small business center a great sauna and whirlpool - The location is great next to a subway station and the bus line 100 to the city center (that bus line 100 is like a free sightseeing tour) Only problem most guest have is that the shower has a temperature nob that sometimes gez stuck at high temperature so no way to shower without get burned - what we did was before we open the shower we hit hard on that showernob an turned the temperature to low - you see some small numbers from 30 to 58, there is no red or blue sign like everywhere else, then we turned the water on and it was okay - i guess when the cleaning people clean the shower they accidentally turn the nob to very hot water

Reviews.Title: “Hugely enjoyable - maybe turn off the house music for breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Clareybella
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly, relaxed and obliging. We really enjoyed our stay and our room. We had a junior suite (non-smoking) and enjoyed the large bed and spa bath. The location was great too.We had one breakfast at the hotel which was great in terms of food and drink but we both found the incessant house music a bit much on a Monday morning. (And my girlfriend is deaf in one ear!) Very private, staffed almost entirely by young good-looking men and we hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “"Axel" ... you going 2 love the bed!!”
Reviews.Author: yarin43
Reviews.Content: for me Axel hotel is the best place in berlin! if you are looking for gay hotel & gay life, Axel give you this 2 options at the same place! do not miss the jacussi upsters!!! This is a hotel where you can see someone nice at breakfast ... and find yourself, a few minutes later spent with him ... in bed!

Reviews.Title: “Great looking hotel, in a ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Dean_LondonUK
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at all 3 Axel Hotel - and this one tops the list for me. Friendly, helpful staff - both Reception and the breakfast boys! Room is functional - not overly large, and storage is limited. I had 3 hangars! Would like to see free WiFi - isn't this becoming standard these days? Roof top spa, a definite plus. Prices vary considerably, and at certain times of year I feel prices are too high for the standard offered. There is considerable choice in Berlin. Aside peak times, I would happily choose Axel Berlin again.

Reviews.Title: “Better not! I paid 798 euro for 3 nights in a junior suite and...”
Reviews.Author: RobyOneK
Reviews.Content: Better not! paid 798 euro for 3 nights in a junior suite and:  Step in the room and it stinks of sigarette, the sofà shows a splash of likely organic stuff. Room tired: night lights arms are sadly broken and heading down, shower door is out of its position, so water spreads around when using it, the worst yet to come: toilet's door  get's blocked, so either you're 'kidnapped' inside once done or you don't close the door at all. Don't you dare to ask for room cleaning after 6 pm, cleaning lady is off. I asked the kind receptionist to care for all these things, but he was not able to solve anything.   Good breakfast and good view: but it's not enough

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel near the best of the Berlin City West and gay nightlife”
Reviews.Author: marcpaquin
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel here and we really enjoyed our stay. The concept is very modern and it works for most of the time. The black walls of the room were a bit depressing, but the room was confortable and clean. We would had appreciated that the gym could be separated from the spa. Both are nice, but I personally don't like to sweat while people are looking at me in a long chair...The wifi could be easier to access for the customers of the hotel, you could only painfully access to the wifi for 24h at a time. After two days, it gets annoying. The hotel have its own social network for gest, but the website and the App could be better. The hotel is very close to the U-Ban and near all the action you should expect in the area. However, the breakfast and the whole service from the staff was perfect and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “you'll have a great stay here :-)”
Reviews.Author: ziggWaW
Reviews.Content: as other people said here already - everything you need is very close to the hotel. Axel itself is a modern place, a bit over the top for me personally. guess I'm not the biggest fan of black walls and mirrors everywhere.. however the staff was superb, from lovely guys at the reception to kind guys in the restaurant. breakfasts - big and tasty. I also liked the small gym and sauna on the top floor. definitely recomend this hotel to anyone, it's hetero-friendly in the end..

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Denny S
Reviews.Content: Upon check-in we were greeted by a friendly staff. During the stay, the staff was attentive, but not always the friendliest. We were impressed by the location and had a great time in Berlin, walking to most everything. The room itself was very spacious and was we expected of a "new" gay hotel. The breakfast was very nice. A little more expensive that what might be comparable from a straight hotel, but we are willing to pay a little extra when the gay thing is done well. Axis did pull it off, and we look forward to trying their other places in Barcelona and Buenos Aires.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Narkis V
Reviews.Content: great hotel, the staff is very friendly and nice, we stay at the suite which was big and fun. the hotel located near the gay area and near the subway station. we had a great and pleasant time in the hotel !!! Narkis V.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: ParisTigrou
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. Extremely nice staff. The room was quite comfortable (though a bit small). Great breakfast. The ourdoor jacuzzi on the rooftop is a fantastic place to end a day of visit. We strongly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “nice and central hotel”
Reviews.Author: geogreek75
Reviews.Content: Axel hotel is situated in the center of Berlin. Next to a subway station, it only takes you min. to go to all the sightseeings. But, nevertheless, you don't have to move a lot with the mass transportation system, because you have everything in a walking distance, like shopping malls, restaurants, bars, clubs, bookstores etc. The rooms are spacious, with nice view and quite clean. The decoration is based on black and gold which might remind you the inside of a club(!) but it's quite modern and luxurious. The music in the lobby and breakfast room also supports that feeling! The only real problem with the room is that the steam from the shower stays in the room because only the toilet room (toilet is separated) has a ventilator. The breakfast buffet has quite a selection of fresh food and it's adequate.The personnel kind and ready to assist you in everything you need.The neighborhood surrounding the hotel is quite and safe. As for the "heterofriendly" statement, the hotel is not what you might thing. On the contrary is quite subtle, approaching homosexuality in an erotic-artistic way, without insulting it's guests, gay or not. Because of that, I recommend it to everyone except families.

Reviews.Title: “The staff is absolutely fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Jan H
Reviews.Content: This hetero friendly hotel is very comfortable, clean and smoothly designed. The breakfast is very nice and the staff has been trained to very best standards. Hotel itself is a bit dark in both rooms and the hallways. From the top floor one can find a spa area with workout room and rooftop jacuzzi. I must say that that is slightly overrated. Basic room is clean and has some interesting design. There is a walk-in shower and tiny bathroom combined without walls to the resting area. It is a very nice idea but unfortunately the steam after the shower stays in the room if one does not open the windows. At least in the room I stayed, there was no ventilation over the shower, only in the toilet. Otherwise everything works in the room pretty well. The hotel is one block away from the Wittenbergplatz tube station and from a good shopping street with famous KaDeWe emporium. There is also a lot of restaurants, pubs and clubs around the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in the Middle of Fuggerstrasse!”
Reviews.Author: Citysam
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel & Facilities! Great staff! I would recommend this hotel to all of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly!!!”
Reviews.Author: earthcitizen415
Reviews.Content: This is a snazzy looking, modern hotel with quick access to the entire city via the U-Bahn one block away. It has all the amenities from an appealing breakfast spread in the morning to the fitness and sauna at night. But the main thing that distinguishes Axel Berlin is the staff! OMG they are the nicest, friendliest people ever.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable for single gay man”
Reviews.Author: blink188
Reviews.Content: I stayed there last November for a quick vacation between jobs. I was travelling alone. as a gay man I found this hotel VERY comfortable as it was clean, well designed, staff was kind. The hotel is very close to Kudam street which is a very good shopping street and is right beside American Apparel and an interesting gay books and magazines shop. A lot of good restaurants in the area and the Wittenberg tube station is a few steps away - it will connect you the red line which covers most attractions - alexanderplats, stadmitte, prenzlawer berg and so on. For me - it was very affordable for a single traveller in a double bed room, the room was rather big in comparison to other European hotels. And I didn't even mention the sexy mood this hotel gives you and the hot boys in there... HAVE FUN!

Reviews.Title: “great location and service”
Reviews.Author: Shai D
Reviews.Content: This is my 5th time at the hotel. evry time i'v been there the sevice was great; breakfest is very nice and the location is very good (very close to Ke De We and lots of places to eat and party). the rooms are not big but they are very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Axel Hotel - the perfect place to stay in Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: ParisOkie
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel conveniently located in central Berlin and right in the heart of the city's gay district. Friendly, helpful staff, great breakfast served until 11am (perfect after a late night out) with a well-equipped workout room, rooftop jacuzzi and solarium. Weekly parties hosted in the hotel's bar will help make your stay lively and entertaining!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Berlin Experience”
Reviews.Author: Frostydog007
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had a Junior Suite for 6 nights and I chose to stay here because of reviews I had read on Tripadvisor. we were was not disappointed. From the friendly faces and recommendations from front of house staff Saul, Matias, Pedro and the fabulous bar staff, Sylvio and Renee and our happy breakfast hosts, Miak and Frederico, Wow - we were made to feel special and were treated so well.- almost like royalty! The room was funky and clean and the overall experience left me wanting more. We shall be back again!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
Reviews.Title: “What an experience!”
Reviews.Author: FabrizioDucca
Reviews.Content: Although I´ve been to Axel Buenos Aires and loved it, it was a nice surprise staying at Axel Berlin! Its location couldn´t be better! Close to many beautiful places, close to many stores and restaurants, and of course all the gay bars! The manager, Oliver, is a sweet, nice and very efficient manager, who makes the hotel more than a place to stay, but a place to feel at home. I am very thankful to Oliver and his staff for the wonderful time we spent there! Can´t wait to go back! Fabrizio from Brazil

Reviews.Title: “Nice but too Chic”
Reviews.Author: wallace404
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel. Perfect location for a gay traveler, cool rooms but a little too chic to really be as comfortable as it could be. Everything is, well, cool but slightly over the top. The staff is very helpful, the breakfast (included) was good. The spa and gym were slightly over rated.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: danzovi101
Reviews.Content: We have previously stayed at the Axel on our annual trip to Berlin, we were impressed with its location and excellent value for money. We recently stayed at the Axel again during January, we were not disappointed. The hotel is situation less than a five minute walk from Wiittenbergplatz Ubahn station, and faced the back of the KaufHaus Des Westerns department store. The hotel itself is clean, well designed full of the amenities for both business and pleasure travellers. There is a clothing optional spar and sauna on the top floor and what looks like a huge sunbathing deck on the roof (obviously not for January). The staff in general are friendly and approachable, and one guy happily spent 10 minutes with us helping us to find a club to go to. There is free internet to guests and a large selected of multi-lingual TV channels. The only criticism of the Axel on this stay is that on the first evening of our stay we reported to the reception that the safe in our room wasn't working (which in our opinion is a necessity) the guy working on reception didn't seem particularly bothered to hear this and informed that he'd send someone up to fix it. He did.... three days later (the day we were due to leave). But all in all we would recommend the Axel to friends, and we shall be visiting again next January,

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, Amazing staff.”
Reviews.Author: Laura P
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel, in a fantastic location, minutes away from the nearest U-bahn, 10- minute walk to the local Zoo and surrounded by great restaurants and shops. The people behind the desk were so so helpful, can't fault them at all. Myself and my partner had never travelled to Berlin and the receptionist were always willing to help us find places. Only slight downside was that we didn't have an iPod dock in our room and my partner didn't bring an iPod charger as we believed we'd have the dock but we were offered a charger from reception. One other small thing as well, I, personally found the pillows on the bed a bit too soft and often woke up with a sore neck but that just may be my own personal observation. Thank you so much Axel hotel for making our holiday amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TiggiNorway
Reviews.Content: Still living at the hotel when I'm writing this. The hotel has a very good location, just behind KaDeWe. The hotel is pretty new. The rooms are not too big but big enough. I have a standard double room for single use. The room has everything I need, even safe and minibar. Bath and shower very good. Very big windows in room. Free and fast internet. Only one thing I miss in room-a chair to sit on. Have to sit in bed all time. Breakfast is good as well. Spa OK. This a gayfriendly hotel. Very many gay people here. I'm not gay, but it worked OK. Even families stay here. Staff very OK.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, but very good in general”
Reviews.Author: docarva
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small and if you want to share the room with a friend be sure you are not shy, as the shower is practically open. By the other hand, the junior suites are just great. The spa is simple, nothing compared to the excellent spas at Axel Buenos Aires and Barcelona, but it is fun. You can get good deals during week days but it is overpriced for weekends. Very friendly staff, especially Pedro, who always had a smile in his face. In general, I recommend the hotel, especially for single travelers who wants to be in that area of Berlim.

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Peter M
Reviews.Content: Fab. service. Hotel with an active atmosphare. :-) Must visit again....

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: cstoke
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for 3 nights and could not fault the welcome and helpful service provided by all the staff,rooms good,spotless and a good comfortable bed,breakfast was very good,great location for all the local bars whatever your preference and the local Berliners made ur very welcome in the Old Timer Bar Opposite the hotel will definitelly go again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Richard W
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel. The staff are really friendly and always with a smile... The rooms are very comfortable and the beds too... Wonderful showering facility. Well located for trains and even walking to the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great, modern hotel at a good price.”
Reviews.Author: Hillpudlian
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I stayed at Axel. You cannot fault the rooms, we have had one up from the basic room each time and you get a big comfy bed, trendy (although not very private!) bathroom. The TV didn't work properly but it didn't bother us. The spa on the top floor is nice to have, there is a steam and sauna room as well as a hot tub (could be warmer). It's a nice spot to sit and read a book and meet other guests. Best thing for us is the proximity to the main gay area, the hotel is perfect for stumbling home at night.

Reviews.Title: “The best choice!”
Reviews.Author: IL9
Reviews.Content: Very recommended place to stay. Very good service and location. I like the atmosphere there.

Reviews.Title: “great position and lovely suite rooms”
Reviews.Author: mikeoz
Reviews.Content: We booked a junior suite at the Axel in Berlin. Having previously liked the Axel in Barcelona, this was our first time in Berlin for a number of years. The hotel is conveniently located one block from a the Underground, and is walking distance to a lot of bars and clubs. Friendly staff, the room was great- we were concerned about road noise initially but didn't hear a thing. Not sure how big the standard rooms are- so book a suite if you can (or upgrade on arrival) Good breakfast. Hotel also has gym and sauna and spa on topfloor- the hot tub was great while it was snowing! Very memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, excellent location, excellent facilities”
Reviews.Author: HelsinkiJom
Reviews.Content: Marvellous hetero friendly hotel in the heart of Berlin (Schöneberg) shopping and gay entertainment area. All the recommendable gay venues are close to Axel. Bars, clubs, saunas, video shops etc. Only 20 mins by taxi from TXL airport ( 20 €). Hotel staff consisting of handsome males in their early thirties were giving the best service I´ve ever met outside Thailand. Really! Those heterofriendly guys made you really feel welcome to the hotel. The rooms were clean and in a very good shape. All the building is designed guite well. The prices are moderate and very competitive among the 4-5 star hotels in Berlin. Breakfast 10 euros only includin all the necessary you require on a healthy breakfast. There were at least double amount of towels in the rooms plus a bath wear kit. The SPA on the 6th floor was open from 8am till 2 am, so enough to relax and exercise in the gym. There is also an open air jaguzzi, steam sauna and a Finnish sauna. I´was there on Jan 2012 and will go back on Feb 2012, Easter time as well as the coming Dec.

Reviews.Title: “Totally recommended”
Reviews.Author: Georges_Kevork
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4 days in early January and I really enjoyed my stay. Apart from everyone being helpful, the hotel was clean, modern and internet speed was good! Which is a rarity in most hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic choice, I loved it!”
Reviews.Author: avs75
Reviews.Content: I know this is a niche hotel but I really enjoyed my stay, went with another 2 friends, we all stayed in separate rooms for a weekend in January 2012. Their feedback was also very good and we would all come back. Good bits: -Great beds, I had a twin room, my friends had king size beds, my room was on the 5th floor, overlooking the courtyard, very quiet, exactly as I wanted. -Lovely bath, wide and large, with good water pressure to fill it quick, -The breakfast was very tasty, good quality bread, salmon and eggs, not a huge selection but there was more than enough and everything I tried tasted good, the tables were clean and tidy and it must be great in summer. -Bathroom was a bit odd as it was in full view of the room, but as I was staying alone, that wasn't a problem. I wouldn't mind sharing a room with a partner but less likely to do so with a friend. There was enough shampoo, shower gel, body lotion, soap for the stay plus a nail file, shower cap, sewing kit and cotton buds/pads in a nice looking box. The bath robe and slippers were a nice touch and very usefull to use at the spa. There were 6 towels in total, 2 hand, 2 bath and 2 large ones for the spa. -The Spa area was nice too, I'm sure they could improve a bit, but all in all I had a good time in the jacuzzi, steam and sauna. There were some guys getting lucky in the jacuzzi but nothing too heavy, really this isn't a place for conservative people or families, specially with underage kids. -My room had enough floor space around the bed and was above my expectation. My friend's rooms were a bit smaller, but one had a jacuzzi and the other a fantastic power shower with lots of water jets. -The staff were efficient but not over friendly, they seemed to do their job well but kept chit chat to a minimum. I'm ok with that. The music on the loddy was nice too. -Free wifi, although it wasn't very fast. I really hope they can re-think the wifi voucher policy, maybe offer codes lasting for 2 and 3 nights, so we don't have to walk all the way to the reception and ask for a new code after 24 hours. Now a bit of constructive criticism: -The jacuzzi wasn't as hot as the ones I tried in Spain and in the UK. In fact, it was the coldest I've ever tried. It could only fit 6 people and was very busy in the evenings. There was space in the solarium for an external hot tub, maybe as an overspill for busy weekends, hopefully management is reading this and can keep it in mind. I really hoped the jacuzzi was bigger. Also, the jacuzzi is outside and the wind was really strong, so bear this in mind if you're not used to the cold. -The floor between the jacuzzi and gym area can get very wet. This is a tricky area as there are showers near the chairs and people walk dripping water all over the place. The steam room could have been hotter and the lighting in the sauna is too bright. -Mirrors in the corridors with black walls... i knew my friends would walk into the mirror after a night out and it happened! It can look stylish but it's a bit over the top. -the bar was always empty, which is a shame as it's a lovely space, maybe the hotel could promote some nights/events, like guest speed dating or happy hour / meet and greet. Anyway, I was nit picking and would love to return to this hotel for another weekend if the price is right. It can be expensive at times and it would compete with 5 star hotels nearby but for people looking to go out and enjoy Berlin's gay nightlife, this is a great option.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, nice service but a sting in the tail”
Reviews.Author: TheGoldenMidas
Reviews.Content: Had a short stay at this hotel in early January. The hotel is huge and located about 20 minutes from Tegel airport by taxi. The welcome was really warm and the staff throughout were extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms are really small so not really suitable for medium to long terms stays, but fine for a short weekend. There's a small black shelf above the hanging area which was thick with dust. Be sure not to put anything up there! Breakfast is great and the breakfast staff were also really friendly. I made a mistake with my internet booking and the hotel refused to change my booking meaning I had to pay for an additional night - I had booked one day early. It was my mistake, but when I arrived at the hotel for my stay it was after 2pm and there were no rooms available - we waited about 30 minutes for a room to be cleaned. I explained that I had effectively had to pay for a room the night before and therefore if they had been able to re-sell my room they should give me some kind of concession. They refused, and this left a bit of a bad taste in my mouth about the stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Warm Welcome at the Axel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: melbourneloft
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay in Berlin over Christmas as I'd heard the Christmas markets were operating all through Christmas and we didn't want to find ourselves in a city where everything closes down. I usually stay in a guest house in Schoneberg but decided to try out the Axel Hotel (also in Schoneberg) for a change. And I'm glad we did. From the moment we arrived we were welcomed and the staff were really friendly. They made sure everyone had what they needed to enjoy their stay. We booked months in advance to take advantage of a 22% rate discount. But on the day we checked in the rate for our rooms was actually lower than the rate we pre-paid. So over Christmas you could wait to get a cheaper rate. The hotel appeared not to be busy when we were there. We stayed a week and I wish we could have stayed longer. We booked the junior suites. They were actually bigger than I expected. Nice big and comfy beds, a big walk through wardrobe, desk area, lounge area, and a massive bathroom with a big bathtub, and lots of clean towels each day. The rooms are cleaned very well every day. The only thing I did not like about my room was that no kettle/tea/coffee making facilities. I asked the desk about where I could get a tea, and they said I could order one through room service. Room service charges 4.50 euro delivery fee on top of the cost of the item. So I wasn't going to pay that much for cups of tea. Even a self serve communal tea/coffee facility would also be nice. Also, the WiFi set up is a bit crazy. You have to get a code from the front desk every 24 hours to keep your internet access going and you have to type the codes in every time you want to access the internet. They print them out on an A4 piece of paper, and you get one for each device. So the two of us had 2 devices each, so over the 8 days we went through 32 codes on 32 sheets of paper. The internet was also pretty sketchy. I had slow internet in room 502 and my friend could not get internet at all inside 302 and ended up buying a stick from the Vodaphone. The rooms are doubled glazed so the traffic noise on Lietzenburger Str is not too bad. But best to ask for a high level room if you stay on the street side. The hotel has a gym with minimal equipment. We used the Fitness First down the road mostly. But on the top floor is also a sauna, steam room and outdoor hot tub. Being a mostly gay hotel we liked the social side of staying there. We met people from all over the world. Everyone is really friendly! I should also mention that the Axel is very well located to the massive department store KaDaWe and the busy shopping strip on Kurfurstendam Str. We shopped a lot and found it easy to bring back bags. It is also very close to a Post Office so we could send some things home. The Axel is also very close to some very nice restaurants and bars. We had some of the best food we've ever eaten in that area. We really loved our stay at the Axel and will be booking in again later this year.

Reviews.Title: “Great mid week stay”
Reviews.Author: jtontravels
Reviews.Content: Very cool modern rooms with spa tubs make for a nice stay. No probs with wifi in room. Bed lovely and comfortable. Friendly staff. Bit annoyed bar not open late at night; should be in a hotel. Gym could do with a pull up bar but otherwise fine. Close to all things gay in nollendorf. Would definitely stay again at the good value mid week rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: AusverGeorge
Reviews.Content: Most of the staff were really attentive. I had several problems with the room they initially allocate for me but they were really keen to solve those issues. Excellent treatment. Rooms, however, have a somehow strabge design but not more than the spa on the top floor. Despite being summer already, iIt was freezing, as there was no cover and people in the apartment bloc next door may see into the area from their windows!

Reviews.Title: “good place”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: The dseign of the the hotel and the room is very modern. Very clean rooms .The staff wher really very friendly and were always ready and willing to answer my questions. Great breakfast(great service,good food). The hotel was clean, quiet, and everyone was very friendly. It was convienient, and a good price. Spa is great as well, whilst small it's very nice and the steam and sauna area and showers is a great area to relax. Internet a bit intermittent. Limited WiFi for personal use. It was only available for a limited time, per day

Reviews.Title: “Central, friendly, great value”
Reviews.Author: Tartantiger10
Reviews.Content: Comfortable rooms, I interesting decor, a very 'sexy' hotel stay! The hot tub on the roof in the cold December evening was perfect

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, ok location, great junior suites”
Reviews.Author: SamW_DC
Reviews.Content: In case it's not clear on the website, this is a 'hetero-friendly', gay hotel in Berlin by the same Axel chain of Barcelona fame. I haven't stayed at the one in Barcelona, but i've been to the rooftop bar & common areas and enjoyed it. The Berlin Axel is a nice hotel situated in a decent area. It's NOT in Mitte or central Berlin, but it's not too hard to get around. There are loads of bars nearby, although the area seems oddly vacant of any good restaurants ('More' was just ok). Check-in was efficient, not exactly friendly, but did the job. We were able to check into our room at 11.30am which was welcomed after a trans-atlantic flight. The Junior Suite was excellent - great color scheme, well-sized, good amenities and a great, comfortable bed. The wireless didn't seem to work in our room because we were pretty far from the router, I believe - but it worked fine in the common areas. There are public computers to use. The gym is small, but the sauna / steam room / jacuzzi are very good. For the prudish amongst you, these spa areas seem to be in full view of neighbouring properties, but wasn't an issue for us. Happy Hour at the bar downstairs was quiet (no more than 4-5 people, although I suspect this changes greatly in the summer), but it was fun to chat with the bartender and relax in hotel surroundings. We were happy with our stay and would probably return. Good value for the money we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel with great facilities in brilliant location.”
Reviews.Author: Ben1982Manchester
Reviews.Content: Axel Hotel is a stylish, trendy hotel with really cool rooms. Staff are friendly and helpful and it's in a great location. The roof top hot tub is brilliant and there's also a sauna, steam room and gym. We didn't try the breakfast but there's a nice bakery opposite for a quick bite. Lots of great bars, clubs and restaurants near by in the gay area. KaDeWe is about 30 seconds walk away too.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in Scöneberg area”
Reviews.Author: Fitchy_gent
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my best friend during a week-end in November (2 nights). We got a fairly good deal for this hotel (Easyjet booking) and upon arrival, we received an upgrade ;-) Our room on the first floor (112) featured a comfortable twin bed, flat screen, jacuzzi with shower, separate toilet, safe, ... The welness & fitness area is on the 6th floor, but the jacuzzi could use some repairing (streams not really working very well). However, the view (Jacuzzi is outside) is very nice ;-) Breakfast buffet is served till noon & offers everything u're looking for. So ideally when you want to sleep a bit! Hotel bar also featured a happy hour on friday evening ;-) We surely enjoyed our stay, and will come back!

Reviews.Title: “Most Unprofessional Hotel Desk Clerk Ever”
Reviews.Author: pjmboston
Reviews.Content: Having stayed (and enjoyed very much) the Axel Hotel in Buenos Aires, we were shocked at the astonishingly poor service and lack of respect we respect on our arrival in the Axel property in Berlin. After check-in early on a Saturday afternoon for a three-night stay, we went to our room and discovered that the light bulb in the toilet room was burned out (the bathroom is divided with the toilet in a separate room). We called down and the front desk clerk himself (named Mathias, according to his badge) came up to the room. He took a quick look at the bulb and announced it was a "special" bulb that could not be easily changed. He said there was "absolutely nothing" that could be done about it until Monday as there would be no technician available until then. We informed Mathias that we were not going to stay in a room for two nights going to the toilet in the pitch dark. He said "perhaps" we could change rooms the next day (Sunday) but said it was "impossible" to change rooms that day (Saturday) because the hotel was all sold out. "All the other guests have checked in?" I asked. "No," he said. "Well then put us in another room and give the room with the burnt out bulb to someone else," I demanded. Mathias sighed. "I cannot possibly do that. It wouldn't be fair to those other guests." I informed Mathias that we were not going to stay in the room and that we were going to re-assemble all our belongings and go down to the lobby until they put us in another room. We went down to the lobby, where we were subjected to insults and sarcasm by Mathias, who continued to insist there was nothing that could be done until Monday. When I suggested that he call someone and have them explain how to change the bulb so he could do it himself, he was aghast. "Do I look like I wear a blue uniform like a mechanic?" he asked. When I continued to insist that we were not going anywhere until the bulb or room was changed, he grew sarcastic. "Do you think you are the king?" he asked. "No," I responded. "I am a paying guest who expects a light in the bathroom." As Mathias was continuing to insist there was nothing that good be done, another person (not in a hotel uniform) intervened and tried to help Mathias explain why it was perfectly reasonable for hotel guests to stay in a room with no light in the bathroom. "Who are you?" I finally asked this other person. He informed me that his was Mathias' "friend." (The hotel manager later told me he also works for the hotel as a part-time masseur.) After several more minutes of drama, the ever-surly Mathias made a phone call, got a ladder and went up to the room. Five minutes later he returned, threw the room key at me and announced the light bulb had been changed. Throughout this adventure I repeatedly asked to speak with the manager. Mathias said the manager was off and would not be back until Monday. I asked to speak with him by phone. Mathias refused. "It's a private number," he announced. I told him he could call the number himself and just give me the phone. Mathias still refused. I asked for the manager's business card. Mathias gave me a hotel business card that did not have any individual's name on it. He told me to call the number on the card. "The manager will answer that number?" I asked. "No," he said. "If you call that number it will ring here and I will answer it." I declined to call the number. Had the room not been pre-paid, I would have checked into another hotel, but we ended up staying for the entire three nights. On Monday I spoke with the hotel manager, who admitted that his desk clerk had acted inappropriately, but made excuses for him. "That doesn't sound like him. Maybe he was tired or in a bad mood." For our trouble, we got breakfast included in the rate. The only good thing I can say about the whole incident is that the waiter from the restaurant (named Michael) who came to cover the desk was professional and polite. All the drama we endured from his colleague, Mathias, over a lightbulb that (it turned out) could be changed in five minutes was unacceptable. I have stayed in hotels all over the world and never experienced like what I experienced at the Axel Hotel in Berlin. Despite the manager's efforts to make excuses, there is no excuse for the treatment we received. We will never stay in that hotel, or any Axel Hotel, again. The free breakfast was nice. Professional treatment at check-in would have been nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable modern and central gay location”
Reviews.Author: seanstu
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights and enjoyed the junior suite even though a little pricey but was a Birthday treat. Didnt see the other rooms but J suite was fairly spacious, clean and comfortable. Hotel website said room had ipod sound dock but info in room says to enquire at reception, I didnt bother but would have used it if was already in the room (maybe you have to pay a deposit or something,dont know) Tea/coffee facilities or complimentary bottled water would be nice as it is supposed to be a Suite. Staff were friendly and helpful and Chris arranged sightseeing bus tickets for us. Did not visit the bar/restaurant but walking past the window it looked classy with some nice looking art work ;-) The Spa area is adequate, very small sauna 2/3 person, same with steam room. As others have said the open air jacuzzi could do with being hotter! Enjoyed our stay and would return to a hotel in this location and to the Axel if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Overall nice hotel; great location!!”
Reviews.Author: BranNewareAtl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days in October and chose a Junior Suite, for a larger room and a few more amenities. The room was a good size, with an interesting and stylish layout with a red glass wall separating the bedroom from the bath. The hotel spaces and rooms are mostly black with a few pops of red or yellow. If you prefer lighter decor, look somewhere else. For us, we liked the modernness of it. It had a great shower with rainfall shower head and wall-mounted sprays and was large enough for anyone to move around if they chose to use the hand-held shower wand. However, the shower stall didn't have any type of lip on it to contain the excess water, so it would leak all over the bathroom tile if there wasn't a towel out to soak it up. We included the breakfast with our room package, and I felt the level of breakfast didn't justify the price. There didn't seem to be much activity in the bar at night and we were there over the weekend. Certainly one of the best features of the hotel was the proximity to Ku'damm and KaDeWe, and public transit. For this reason, I certainly might consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hmm very average”
Reviews.Author: Steve222_11
Reviews.Content: Plus points - very friendly staff and comfortable beds. However the WIFI in room does not work as the signal is not strong enough. I found this very annoying. Also no wardrobe in room. The shower made a mess. There is was insufficient soft lighting. Also only one chair in the room. The bathroom products stripped my skin, there was no hair conditioner provided either. Overall Axel is a glamourous version of Travelodge. Overall a very average stay..

Reviews.Title: “Superb location however lacks style”
Reviews.Author: JamesA045
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Axel Hotel in Berlin in November. The hotel is very well situated in the leafy gay-quarter of Schoenberg very closed to Ku'damm and KDV department store. The hotel staff were extremely polite, friendly and helpful however the rooms were somewhat kitsch and the quality of furnishings was not good - the bathroom in particular was small and products provided not up to scratch for the money. The restaurant serves bar food/room service which was priced ok but again not great quality. The hotel is gay with a gay clientele so probably would not be suitable for families. In summary, the positives were the staff and high level of service - on the downside, the rooms/hotel style and quality was poor and overpriced for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: Sydney_Bloke
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently and found the hotel to be adequate. The bar was nice for a quiet drink. The breakfast was good. Not a great selection of food, but adequate. The room was on the small side and the decor may not suit everybody, but I didn't mind it. Black fittings show up a lot of dust however if not wiped down everyday. The staff for the most part were friendly. The girl on the front desk in the morning was surly. I would say good morning or goodbye but not get a response, gave up in the end. People like that shouldn't work in customer service. The guys on the front desk were friendly however. Housekeeping was not that good, the room was made up at any time of the day and was therefore not predictable. One day the room was not made up at all. Hotel is marketed to young gay European men I thought. Therefore, not the international standard hotel you would find in Asia for example. I guess if you don't get out of Europe much you would think this a luxury hotel. The best thing about the place is its location near the main gay area of Berlin and close to the U Bahn. I most likely would not stay here again. Would stay more up market next time in Berlin, and for the price you pay to stay here, that would not be hard.

Reviews.Title: “Not the fab hotel expected”
Reviews.Author: MrHB
Reviews.Content: I have heard so much about Axel Hotels so when planning a trip to Berlin the choice was easy. As I knew I had to do some work over the computer I booked the three nights in a junior suite for a little bit more space and comfort. The hotel itself is located in a great spot close to bars, restaurants, shopping and underground. The hotel had great staff and a good breakfast area. But the rooms are old and worn out and the charm is gone. The bed is really not up to standard for a "suite" - I had back pain going back home after the three nights. And then we had the Wi-Fi... It simply did not work in the room. Also other guests at the hotel said the same. So the whole idea of booking the junior suite was not really worth it. But when I complained about it they could not do much. But when I went back again they offered to take the breakfasts away from the bill. Not to bad. Would I go back again...? No.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly very good.”
Reviews.Author: NorthernRiversNSW
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Axel Hotel in Barcelona in August and were pleasantly surprised with how good it was. This stay at the Axel Hotel in Berlin provided an equally comparible experience, although this time I was travelling for business and by myself. Check in and check out was easy and efficient and I found the staff at all times to be friendly and helpful, with a special mention of Chris, who always provided a greeting and smile each time I walked past the desk. The hotel is well located for shopping, restaurants and the metro, and ideally located for the Schoneberg gay bars, shops and clubs. The clientele seemed to be mainly gay men across a range of ages, singles and couples, and I also noticed quite a few women. My room was on the 2nd floor and faced the main road. The sound proofing was fine, the free wifi connection was fast, the room was clean, the shower had good pressure and the bathroom amenities and toiletries were adequate. Yes, all of the mirrors and black walls can seem a bit much, but I liked the fact the decor was different and it seemed to suit the hotel. My rate included breakfast and whilst the range on offer at the buffet isn't huge, it covers most tastes and was more than adequate. My only complaints are that the bed was way too hard for my liking and the a/conditioning wasn't very effective. Not having a comfortable sleep and not being able to find a comfortable temperature are two big issues and whilst the Axel Hotel in Berlin was quite OK in all other respects, I would probably stay elsewhere next time because of these reasons. Which is a shame, because as a gay traveller, I really like the concept of a heterofriendly hotel and the Axel chain seem to be doing it well.

Reviews.Title: “Great design, but seems dirty and worn out.”
Reviews.Author: dkmerrifield
Reviews.Content: The hotel caters primarily to gay men, but we did notice some male/female couples in the lobby. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and the hotel is located very close to several gay bars, clubs, and shops. However, it's not very close to the tourist attractions in Berlin. There are also plenty of brochures in the lobby to give you ideas of what to do on your vacation. Unfortunately, the rooms at the hotel are small and very dark, and looked like they'd seen better days. The black walls make any smudge very evident (use your imagination), and didn't give you the impression that the rooms are cleaned thoroughly. Additionally, the housekeeping staff and/or equipment they used smelled very bad. Also, on the first day they took our used towels from the rack but did not replace them. The second day, we had three different people come to our room to clean, check up on the cleaning, and check the mini-bar (even though we told them we hadn't taken anything). If you want privacy, make sure you put the sign on your doorknob. If you're planning a gay vacation, this may be the perfect hotel for you. But after one stay, I would probably choose another hotel for my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “"branding gay" is not "quality" in itself”
Reviews.Author: ChristianR153
Reviews.Content: Location central but not really nice neighbourhood = highway and run down sex shops and alike... so if youre not really into the oldfashioned sneaking gay life or the hardcore scene, there are other more romantic places to stay in Berlin, even if you belong to this hotel's target group. The hotel has high ambitions, but its hard to reach the level of the sister hotel in Barcelona. Breakfast is not same quality, and the facilities are generally at lower class. The all blacjk interior fades fast, and the rooms are stylish but very un-practical even for a short stay. Three hangers and one bathrobe for two persons... water from the shower all over the bathroom floor and so on. The designer did not have much experience with hotels.. Even the hardware shortcomings, the staff is nice..

Reviews.Title: “excellent place”
Reviews.Author: domjoy
Reviews.Content: it is a very good place. nice and professional people are working there. they are very helpful and friendly. great atmosphere. the price is okay. the rooms are clean, sometimes a little bit too small. wonderful bathroom and shower. and when you get hot water then it is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Service at Last!”
Reviews.Author: ButterButter
Reviews.Content: I went on this vaccation, to relax and have a quiet time. Axel hotel certainly helped a lot. The staff was very proffesional, friendly, and extremely helpful,every single one of them. The hotel was very clean and comfortable which made me spend a lot of time in. I was upgraded to a suite which was spaceous with a huge comfortable bed and a jaccuzi :) The position of the hotel was very convenient, near prominent shops, bars, clubs, etc. and a train station, making it accessible to the rest of Berlin. This will undoubtedly be the hotel I'll stay in whenever I'm in Berlin Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “the perfect gay hotel”
Reviews.Author: naum m
Reviews.Content: i have stayed at the Axel Hotel many times during my visits to berlin the staff are outstanding and extremely friendly, very sheik and clean. The roof top spa is great place to get away for total relaxation. Free Wifi and a great breakfast would recommend this hotel to anyone. Perfect location and great value for price.

Reviews.Title: “I give it a B-”
Reviews.Author: MatthewGreen
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Axel in Barcelona we thought we'd give this hotel a go for a long weekend (Thurs to Sun). It's modern, trendy, clean and has a nice spa on the 6th floor. Additionally the location is good, especially for visiting the gay neighbourhood which seems to be concentrated in this area. I know the hotel chain goes with the tag-line "heterofriendly" and there were quite a few straight couples staying, but if I'm honest I'd probably warn straight people off staying unless they are comfortably open minded! We paid a little bit more for a superior room and to be honest, I'm not sure if it was worth it. The room was oppressively dark and didn't have a wardrobe but it was spotlessly clean and the bed was very comfortable with good quality linen. Slightly annoying that there was only one bathrobe and one pair of slippers although I'm sure they would have provided another if asked. The 6th floor spa/gym was very pleasant with a small gym, showers, sauna, steam room and hot tub. Be warned most guests are men and the spa (despite requests for people to be appropriately attired) tended to be a "naked zone" for many of the guests. However, we didn't see anything untoward going on so fortunately it wasn't like a gay sauna. Also it was slightly disappointing that the hot tub was more a "lukewarm tub" and that there were no additional towels available. To sum up, it was a comfortable and well located hotel although a bit dark and dingy and perhaps a little soulless. It doesn't quite compare to their Barcelona hotel but it is a lot cheaper!

Reviews.Title: “Booking it again!”
Reviews.Author: Charles G
Reviews.Content: Though this hotel is located next to the gay area of Berlin, the hotel promotes itself as heterofriendly. And indeed we saw some straight couples and a lot of single women checking in (perhaps they feel safer here?). The top floor has an excellent small gym/sauna/steam room and a covered outdoor jacuzzi with a great view (though jacuzzis in Germany are not the boiling pots of water we Americans are used to and we had to go in the sauna afterwards to warm up). Being a gay man, I was comfortable with the atmosphere on the top floor (I only saw men frequenting it) and saw nothing out of the ordinary. The standard room is small but comfortable and stylish, lacks closet space and the shower is not very private though functions terrifically.Comfy bed. Quiet room. Staff was friendly (they let us borrow their corkscrew for wine and didn't even ask for our room number). We were able to walk to all the mafor sites (I'm used to walking 4 miles a day) and it was great to have friendly bars within walking distance of the hotel. Excellent pastry/coffee shop across from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great times”
Reviews.Author: Katie_I_Essex
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a couple of nights. Room was clean and I loved the Jacuzzi bath tub in my bathroom. I enjoyed taking a bath before hitting the town. The location is just perfect, very close (walking distance) to the Ku'damm which is good for shopping, a Night out or to start a Sight-seeing Tour. to explore Berlin. There is also several Bars and Restaurants around the Hotel incase you want to enjoy a quick sundowner or you are starving. Public Transport is fantastic in Berlin, very organized and close to the hotel. Spa Area with pool and gym was lovely, The staff was friendly and helpful. I really loved the Urban bar, service was great. I have to admit that you have to be open-minded as most of the guest are gay. It doesn't bother me but it might make other people feel uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “heterofriendly is more than a slogan”
Reviews.Author: GosuSolihull
Reviews.Content: A comfortable hotel in a lively "Soho" type location. Staff helpful and friendly. However as a heterosexual couple this would not have been our choice had we known that it is a hotel aimed specifically at gay men. Whilst not having a problem with the sexual preferences of others we found the decor,the many pictures of partially clad young men, the tv screen home page and the spa and massage facilities were definitely not aimed at us. The "heterofriendly" slogan needs to mean more than filling up spare rooms with general tourists. The hotel is clearly aiming at the gay community and travel companies need to make this very clear. Ours didn't . We found the decor oppressive,it being mainly black,mirrored or tinted glass. The bedroom had little storage (less than a Travelodge) , no tea or coffee making facilities and relatively small windows which due to the black walls and furniture made the room depressing. We have read a description of the decor as being "sexy" and "stylish". However black shows the dust and when the paintwork is chipped and part of the ceiling to floor black velvet curtain is hanging from its rail, the overall impression is one of tiredness. The shower is large, glazed on both sides and effective but as it is in the bedroom it will flood into the same if it is on full flow. The washbasin is also in the bedroom. Breakfasts were very good and the serving staff efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Urgh”
Reviews.Author: Kurosaki_Ichigo
Reviews.Content: Loved the Axel Hotel in Barcelona, but the Berlin one pales by comparison. Room (junior suite) wasn't ready when we checked in at 6pm. Room, especially toilet and shower, was less clean than desired. The shower, while nice, tended to flood into the main bathroom. Finally, don't try the room service. My lasagna was still partially frozen when it was delivered. I tried to bring it to the front desk's attention but the lady simply told me to bring it to the room service kitchen in the back. On the plus side, room was creatively designed. Location was good; a few minutes to the Wittenbergplatz Bahnhof, KaDeWe and Ku'damm. But on the whole, left a lot to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, clean and friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sabrina G
Reviews.Content: If you want to have a nice and friendly period of resident, stay the time in the Axel Hotel in Berlin, near the Kurfürsten Damm (Lietzenburger Straße 13-15). The Rooms are very clean and have a nice style. The cloros of the Hotel are anthracite and yellow (very stylish). The personal is very friendly and professional. I will advice this Hotel to my friends and workmates.

Reviews.Title: “Nice summer stay”
Reviews.Author: buiumb
Reviews.Content: It's a concept Hotel - Gotta love the design. Excellent location!!! Good front desk service Good Spa&Nice Jacuzzi And nice tan roof Hotel manager refers guest requests Nice and very quickly

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, efficient manager. Will stay again.”
Reviews.Author: cubacubaSydney
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed here, and will stay again. The location is wonderful, great neighbourhood, lots of bars and restaurants within minutes of the hotel, both gay and straight (no-one seems to care either way in Berlin!). Also only five minutes to KaDeWa and the K'Dam. Couldn't ask for better location, with a convenience store right next door with English newspapers, soft drinks, etc. Also hairdressers, nail salons, etc. all nearby. easy parking everwhere. It is the area you would want live if you were to move to Berlin. Staff always friendly, will get a taxi for you within just minutes, any time of day or night. Very helpful with advice. Perfect English for us non-German speakers. And do get a room with the breakfast package....one of the best breakfast buffets on our trip, and a lovely lawned couryard to eat in good weather. The manager, Oliver Boehme, is very approachable, and efficient, and anxious to meet his guests at the evening drinks reception, and responds to any requests promptly. An asset to the organisation. The rooms are slightly quirky, and it takes a little getting used to the black decor and the mirrors, but a very comfortable bed. Hanging / storage space is a little limited. Shower tends to flood the floor if not careful. Could do with an internet computer station on each floor (rather than just two floors, as thetyget busy), although we had a larger room with WiFi. Great place to stay. in Berlin. We are recommending it to our daughter and son-in-law for their visit next month, and have recommended other friends all of whom have been pleased with their stays. Definitely a fun place to stay, and to us the best location in town.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever again!”
Reviews.Author: coupleberlin
Reviews.Content: We consider ourselves a young, easy-going gay couple, but what meant to be a romantic weekend for a special occasion in a 4-star gay hotel in the centre of Berlin turned out to be a bit of a troublesome experience. The location is nice, and that's about it!! For the price this hotel charges (650 euro for 4 nights for a regular double room!) you can find much better hotels in the area. The first day we returned back to the hotel, we realized the room had not been cleaned or made up. So we friendly notified reception staff about this matter and they assured us it would be cleaned the day after. However, one day later: same scene... room not cleaned! A bit more aroussed we demanded to speak to the manager ("U really want to speak to someone- YES") and a young girl apologized ("new cleaning firm" "still have to learn how to clean ?"...blabla), told us the room would be cleaned the day after (not more than normal ??). By scrolling down former reviews on Tripadvisor, we saw that the hotel already had to deal with this kind of issue some years ago (un-cleaned rooms) and apparently after these years they still are not able to manage this problem, no matter what fancy words have been written about it. Completely UN-exceptable, not worth 4 stars and definitely not worth the price rates they charge. The lady in charge gave us a 90euro reduction (not even worth one night!) and a drinking voucher. We should also mention the Sky bar does not exist anymore (although the hotel still keeps mentioning it on its website and in the elevators), so we drank our free drink in the Urban bar downstairs - a tasteless bubbleless Prosecco, not even worth mentioning, but we do it anyways since it seems to be the major problem of this hotel: no quality, no service: just pay your money (no-refund policy, by the way) and get out. Never ever again for us!

Reviews.Title: “Nice try, but would not return”
Reviews.Author: Michael S
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at this hotel. We have stayed at Axel hotels in Barcelona and Buenos Aires. This hotel is not up to the same standard as the Barcelona and Buenos Aires properties. It is not interesting or exciting in any way. Unfortunately, it is dull and boring! The room we had was a junior suite, the "Berlin Suite." It was large, but strangely configured, without being comfortable. It had more space for the dressing and closet areas than in the bathroom. There was a large tub, but a small stall shower. The shower leaked water through the shower door onto the bathroom floor, which was wet most of the time. The room attendants were late each day, which made it difficult to use the room until they arrived at 20:00 the first day to clean the room. The next day was somewhere around 16:00. There seemed to be an absence of people, both guests and hotel employees, at this hotel. The staff was mostly pleasant. Don't bother with the breakfast buffet unless you get it inexpensively. The computer for the business center has no printer. The wireless internet is insane! You need to re-enter a ticket number every time you enter the hotel to sign on each device. We had to sign onto the internet many times each day just on our iPhones. It was annoying. Each day, the ticket and password changes, so we had to call to the front desk or have them print a new one. The outside spa (hot tub) is in a small area, and is locked later at night. The access to the spa and fitness center is strange and cumbersome. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom area was very dark!! The vibe of the hotel is supposed to be hip and fun, but it is not hip or fun at all!! We saw a lot of unhappy faces, especially on check-in since rooms are cleared so slowly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jamie C
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Beautiful rooms. Sauna was amazing and comfortable. The staff is amazing. Great location for gay Berlin. Go on the walking tour of Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, Great location and great Service”
Reviews.Author: Steve L
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were a bit worried about staying after reading the last two reviews, but our worries were sweep away when we arrived and were greeted pleasantly by reception, we got a room on the 4th floor, one bed was a bit wonky, I spotted the wheel was broken: did I ring up to complain? No, I fixed it myself. I was ok with the decor, the hallways are painted black with some orange lights which adds to the cruisey atmosphere, the room decor was lovely: black with gold and cream it workrd well. I can't understand other people's gripes about the colour scheme. We found the location on the edge of one of the gay areas in town to be excellent both for the scene and for travelling via Wittenbergplaatz. I would highly recommend this hotel as the location and the service were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel service ever! The Axel brand should be ashamed!”
Reviews.Author: sdjlg
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because I stayed at the Axel in Barcelona a few years back and liked it. Big mistake - the Berlin property was horrible! I won't even speak about design or decor of the hotel - that's subjective and some people would like it and some won't - it's an all black hotel - probably to hide the dirt. I didn't like the design but that's not my issue with this hotel at all. The issue was with the complete garbage they call service. The General Manager, Oliver Boehme likes to respond to trip advisor reviews I see, but perhaps he should focus on training his staff or getting rid of them and hiring better ones to make better use of his time. There are the same few people working at the front desk every day - they have no Concierge, or any other services to speak of besides a rooftop fitness room/sauna. The lobby bar and restaurant never had a soul in them - even on the weekends in the summer ....in a gay hotel...in the gay neighborhood - kind of a sign right there that it's a poorly run establishment. I arrived around 9am and the front desk clerk looked at me and said "you're too early, you can't check in" - not, "I'm sorry, we have no rooms available", not, "let me see how long it will be" - just - "you're too early, you can't check in". Later in my stay I asked that same clerk some reccommendations on where to go out. I was floored when his response was "I don't know". You're gay, working in a gay hotel, in a gay area and a paying guest asks for some suggestions and you say "I don't know"?? - I mean even if you don't go out yourself - being a hotel employee you should be aware of your area so you can help guests (a far cry from what they do at Axel). One morning asked a female desk clerk directions, which she rattled off as if I was born and raised in Berlin. When I asked her to write them down, she rolled her eyes like it was the greatest chore. The other female desk clerk never looked up from the desk - she would keep her head down even when guests approached. I asked the original desk clerk for a wake up call on my final night which he confirmed. When I got home later that evening and double checked, sure enough - no wake up call noted. The evening clerk's response to my dismay was "I don't know - I've been on vacation and just got back" - Thank god I double checked knowing the shoddy service levels. I cannot believe the Axel chain tolerates this kind of poor service. Hopefully before you respond to my review, you'll have some good news about staff turnover, training and a better presence from senior management Mr. Boehme. I'm sure the reputation of the Axel brand should not be tarnished by the complete and utter disregard for providing even 2 star service levels at 4 star prices.

Reviews.Title: “Hetero friendly or LGTA rip-off? Either way, better stay somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: Seasonedtraveller023
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 nights at the Axel hotel in Berlin – this is enough time not only to get a real good feel for a place, but it also to see how things are done and maintained (or in this case, not). From the very beginning I experienced the poor level of maintenance at the hotel and overall my stay was a resounding disappointment. Check-in: I was informed that my “unchangeable & non-cancellable” pre-paid reservation was in fact not pre-paid, because, and I quote:, "what our website says and does is two different things". So Axel's administrative procedures are misleading and not clear. And of course it gets worse, much worse. Standard room: Extremely small and not cheap. Don’t even think about renting this type of room if you are 2 persons, because even with only one suitcase, you could hardly move around the room. Junior suite: I later moved to a junior suite and while this type of room is larger, if you happen to be 2 people, only 1 person can sit down as there is only one chair (again, this is in a junior suite). Other: The hotel's TV system does not work properly at all. At the gym/spa area, the training equipment is not in good order and make so much noise that it disturbs the other guests. The air conditioning system in the hotel simply did NOT work. This is important, as you cannot really open the windows and the hotel is located on a busy street. The Spa area in general is not well maintained at all. The air is poor and the only air duct present in the gym is so dirty and completely filled with dust and grime that it is probably a breeding ground for mould and mildew and who knows what other air borne bacteria! See attached picture. And this in an area where you are supposed to be breathing heavily and exercising. The whole SPA floor area was covered in cold water (uncomfortable, very slippery and dangerous). The hot sauna was not hot at all and the steam sauna was so cold that nobody stayed in it. The outdoor Jacuzzi was also very cold and made staying outside impossible as well. This is without a doubt, the worst spa area of any hotel I have ever been in. Very very disappointing, especially if you consider the type of clientele are trying to appeal to. Room service: Ineffective & rude. I had to order some ice as there were no ice machines on any of the floors (this is 2011 by the way…). After waiting for over 30 minutes, I decided to go down and get it myself. I was informed by a very rude waiter that he had been to my room 3 times (obviously he had gone to the wrong room). To penalize ME, he adds: “normally the ice is free, but because I had to go upstairs 3 times, I am going to charge you 4.50 Euros for the ice. Nice “on the fly” policy making and flexible pricing if you ask me. Housekeeping: Highly inefficient and disorganized. Two days in a row, after leaving the "clean room" sign on our door at 9am, it was still not clean when we returned to the hotel at 5pm!!!. I had to move the bed slightly because I dropped something behind it - the walls behind the bed where stained and dirty and the floor was full of dust (see picture). There were also some very nasty (and very visible) stains on the bedcover = gross (see pic). The carpets in the hallways were dirty. When returning to my room one day, I found a letter and a fax on my desk that was not even addressed to me. A member of staff had left confidential correspondence addressed to the hotel on the desk of a hotel guest. Nice move. There was also a break and large cracks in a large mirror that no one thought was necessary to fix or replace. I was so frustrated by my stay at this hotel that I asked to speak with the hotel manager. I was informed that he was not in, but given his business card. I then took the time to write Mr. Olivier Boehme a detailed complaint and recommendation letter that was sent on the 10th of July. I specifically asked him to get back to me with his reactions and reply. It is now the 16th of August – so more than a month later and he didn’t even have the professionalism or decency to respond. Hence that is the reason I have decided to make this review public on Trip Advisor. I believe Axel hotels could have been on to something with the positioning of their chain, but frankly, it appears more like they are trying to take advantage of a clientele that they consider won over in advance and not worth working too hard for. What they fail to recognize is that this is also a well travelled and demanding clientele. If you want better value and much better service, stay at the Hilton, Marriott or any other place for that matter – no doubt you will also be encouraging a lot of the LGTA community who happen to be working in those places too.

Reviews.Title: “Back to black ...”
Reviews.Author: Traveller_Europe_78
Reviews.Content: I was in Berlin for one night for business and checked into the centrally-located Axel Hotel, which I'd booked in advance. The staff were perfectly friendly and offered advice about where I could pick up a pizza locally in the evening (as I thought their restaurant was overpriced with a very limited menu). I took advantage of the (slow, but free) wifi service (would have happily paid for a high-speed connection though and while the bed was very comfortable, the room itself was oppressive .... black black and more black. I don't know what kind of designer thinks that black is a welcoming colour, but it wouldn't surprise me if I learned he was German! The windows don't open fully, so it was difficult to air the room; in any case, the street outside was very loud, so make sure you have an odd-numbered room number, which would look onto the courtyard at the back. Breakfast in the morning was standard German fare; nothing special, though relatively cheap at just €13.50. The fancy shower, however, was so fancy that it wouldn't produce cold water (or rather, water anything less than boiling hot!). Additionally, the fancy design meant that the power shower leaked all the way across the bathroom onto the carpet. Great design is only great when it works .... Not sure I'll stay here again, but it's worth a look. I generally like the Axel brand, and their Barcelona Hotel is amazing. Their Berlin one, however, ain't quite up to the same standard in my view.

Reviews.Title: “Very very small rooms and gets hot and stuffy. Fab location though.”
Reviews.Author: Southamptonboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a city break. Fantastic location and very friendly helpful staff on reception. Only problem was the size of the rooms. On booking in we were told we had been upgraded to a suite, which excited me on the lift on the way to the room, until we opened the door and it appeared to be the size of a cupboard! Definitely not a suite, although on the top floor of the hotel. The hotel was clean and lovely spa and again very very good attentive staff. fab location. But tiny rooms which get hot and stuffy, only let down but quite a major flaw.

Reviews.Title: “Different, wouldn't return though.”
Reviews.Author: IanMakinson1
Reviews.Content: The Axel is well placed for the scene in Schoenberg & is very contemporary in style. The theme is all black with some gold trim, whilst this looks good initially it makes it seem very dark & more like living in a night club. There's plenty of mirrors on the Walls in an attempt to throw mire light around the place, in reality this actually makes walling down the corridors confusing & you're more likely to walk straight into s wall. We stayed in a junior suite having already heard the standard rooms are on the small side, and I'm glad we did, though the suite was really small & badly organised in terms of layout. The bathrooms are pleasant with a good shower, although I distinctly disliked the clear red Perspex wall between the bathroom and the head of the bed in the bedroom - it gives you no sense of privacy at all. Storage wise, well there is none really apart from 6 hangers & 3 tiny draws for clothes, so if on more than a 2 night stay it would be frustrating. An annoying part of the room was that whilst the room had good blackout curtains, there was a window in the bathroom that then let's the early morning light in because of the red Perspex between the 2 rooms. There's a small bar on the roof although because of the rain we didn't have chance to try it. The gym/sauna/ steam room area were quite nice,though there's not much in the way of equipment and the sauna & steam room are on the small side. The downstairs bar area is quite a nice place to chill out because of the relaxing music & lack of people.  We had pre booked the breakfast for our 3 night stay & whilst the first mornings breakfast was pleasant & reasonably well stocked, the Sunday morning breakfast was a farce, it was not especially busy, nor were we late, however there was either no  food available or when it actually got replenished, there was then no crockery! Fortunately monday mornings offering was more on track. Staying was an experience, I'd not return though as there's far better value hotels in the vicinity; although this is a predominantly gay hotel, I was left with the feeling that I'm paying for the privilege of staying, rather than paying for good service.

Reviews.Title: “What a cool gay spot”
Reviews.Author: Dre0303
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern in look and basic in service. With a mostly gay male clientel and in the heart of ther big gay bars and venues the place is great for those looking for an adventure. The staff was friendly and the location great for seeing a lot of Berlin on foot or by metro. There's a gym at the top with a spa, but no pool. Expect to be cruised, so it may not be a place to go as a couple.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not so great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Constant_traveller45
Reviews.Content: The Axel is perfectly located; too bad it is far from perfectly staffed. The staff is, in fact, unfriendly, uninterested and unhelpful. You are treated as an unwelcome presence in a day they do not seem to enjoy. The thought of offering suggestions or advice never enters their minds. I stayed here when it first opened and wanted very much to return; now that I have, I am sorry and did and will never make the same mistake again. Berlin has too many nice hotels to waste one's time here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Snarfdoog
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. It is so refreshing to have a gay hotel that provides a pleasant, relaxing atmosphere. It is close to all of the bars and restaurants as well as to the main shopping areas. The staff is awesome...very polite, welcoming and helpful. Can't beat the price either when booking via a travel company.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: Jamesr0253
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel for a total of 3 weeks this year and it was a fantastic experience. The rooms are not huge, but the amazing staff make up for this. Michael, Chris all of them are fantastic and make this hotel. Well done guys can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Service & staff far better than facilities.”
Reviews.Author: Arnaud21
Reviews.Content: The staff is among the friendliest I've found anywhere, anyplace. You feel as if you've known them before. Very warm welcome at front desk. Thank you for that. Sylvio is a gem for the hotel: friendly, helpful, respectful, and makes you feel relax while either eating or having a drink at the bar. The location of the hotel is EXCELLENT! Just accross KaDeWe, a stone's throw from the Zoo, the U, Ku'dam area and many neighborhood restaurants out of the tourist area. Regretfully, the rooms are very small. Black painted hallways do not add to the "upbeat feel good mood" the hotel should have and promotes, and you need a closet, and more hangers. Beds are ok and linens very good and crisp! Items sold at window display are tacky, sexually related and unnecessary, just cheapens the lobby. If anyone wants any of those, there are plenty of stores around to find them. Just small details would enhance the experience from the facilities from ok to good. Room service was delivered before promised: A+++ for Sylvio. Watch out for upkeep of facilities since it seems that hotel was opened 10 years ago. Thank you for treating us more as family than guests! A BIG plus for you for that.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, small room at good location”
Reviews.Author: whatever4631
Reviews.Content: Good location, nice enough hotel, though rooms were small for this class and pricepoint in Berlin (where we have stayed a number of times before). Location is convenient to gay area and a large shopping district which include KaDeWe. Service needs inprovement to be 4 star as advertised.
