We hung the please clean sign on our room two days in a row at 9.30 a.m. and returned at 4.30 p.m. to find an unclean room and were told by hotel staff the first day that they had had 40 checkouts and had not been able to get to our room in the 7 hours we were gone. The second day same thing happened AFTER we stopped by front desk in the morning to specifically ask that the room get cleaned. When we came back and found it still dirty, we complained again to front desk and had to leave the room for two hours while they made sure it was clean. This is a HOTEL right? Expecting one's room to be cleaned during a 7 hour period is reasonable, right? TIP: If you stay here, do not get a room on the 5th floor as the cleaning staff (yes they do have one) clean the spa area at 7 a.m. which necessitates dragging the heavy wood spa chairs on the floor which will, of course be your ceiling, if you are in rooms 514, 512, 510, 508.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, excellent location, confusing rooms”
Reviews.Author: NowVoyager42
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nites in early July. Location very convenient to two subway stops, major bus lines and the extraordinary KaDeWe department store. The staff were uniformly pleasant and helpful, both with accommodations and with general Berlin information. Breakfast was hearty, and at the $10 pre-pay rate, a real bargain. Dinner at the restaurant was so good that we were disappointed when the waiter mentioned it would soon close in evenings for lack of business. The genuinely gay-positive atmosphere is also a big plus -- and the free internet points made a big difference. That said, it's also true that the hotel is classic example of design over function. The rooms and corridors are maddening mazes of black walls at odd angles with unexpected turns, mirrors and odd lights, as if we were not renting a hotel room but the back room of an after-hours nightclub. In our jr suite, the bathroom, shower and sink were in area separated from bed by strange see-through wall; the access point on either side was curved mirrored walls (think circus Fun House) that I literally walked into twice -- in daylight. The high-tech chrome shower was so confusing that, with some embarrassment, we had to ask for help from the front desk to adjust the water (a need that has surely never surfaced in 30 years of travels). The fact that the desk clerk had trouble, too, and could only adjust the water after wrapping a towel around one of the knobs was small consolation. Someone was a little too full of himself when he designed these rooms. The hotel is great in many ways, but the maddening design features mean guests spend too much energy trying to navigate its basic functions.

Reviews.Title: “A good brand at a good price”
Reviews.Author: ChrisTocino
Reviews.Content: At the Axel Hotel you get style without the attitude. The pros include: (1) friendly and helpful staff; (2) stylish (albeit small) rooms with good lighting and great showers; (3) nice spa area , (4) free and reliable internet (officially, they charge for it, but they provided us with complimentary internet for the four days that they were there), and (5) a very fair price. The minuses: (1) minimal storage - two drawers and four hangers, and (2) inadequate airconditioning, which required us to keep the windows open at night notwithstanding the noise on the street below.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel Value, in the heart of the gay district and shopping”
Reviews.Author: JMCToronto
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a trip to Berlin and a stay at the Axel Hotel. I thoroughly enjoyed the central location from which the majority of bars and clubs in Berlin's gay commuinty are only few minutes walking distance from the hotel's front door. The neighbourhood is a tree filled section of the city and across the street in the next "platz" is the subway, and Berlin's finest Department Store "KaDeWe" (keep your eye out for US celebrities shopping in the stores vast floors). The hotel was great value for the money. I stayed in a junior suite (Buenos Aires suite) that was large, had an excellent views from it's 5 floor perch, and a great bathroom with large jazcuzzi tub and seperate toilet area with a large seperate glass shower. Staff were very gracious and helpful in offering maps, club and sight seeing tips etc. The restaurant on the main floor offered a good but nothing special bfast in the morning that "is not included" in your room rate. This hotel is "hetero" friendly, but make no mistake about it....they are targeting the LGBT community and the vast majority of guests were gay. The top floor of the hotel housed a spa area with good wieghts and equipment, a sauna (too hot), steam room (too cold) and outdoor jacuzzi overlooking the city (way too cold water temperature). The area was often strewn with used towels and sometimes garbage, the hotel should have staff checking and cleaning the area hourly. Also the hotel provides a computer with internet access on floor 2 and 3 but not 4 and 5. This means that often you are waiting or can not access the computer. I would recommend that the hotel include work stations on the other two floors as well. While I did not get charged for wirless internet in my room, the hotel literature says there is a charge. Perhaps they stopped actually charging as the system is often "overloaded" and you can't log on unless its very early in the morning or late at night. I can not understand how a city the size of Berlin and a hotel in the heart of that city can not offer wirless access free of charge that works properly. Also you must pay to watch TV. Again I found this odd, movies I understand being charged for for regular television? Be prepared their King size beds are simply two standard beds taped by the legs together. This means that unless you sleep on either side of the bed you slip in the crack that runs down the middle. Again in a country like Germany and a city the size of Berlin do they not manufacture King size beds? Would I stay there again? Absolutely, but in hopes that the spa area, wirless service and bed issue be attended to. Overall it is a stylish boutique hotel that offers great value for the money in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Best gay hotel, but not good value compared to other hotels in the city!”
Reviews.Author: Vendelbo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Axel hotel for our second time and when we arrived they upgraded us to a superiour room for free, so we could get a room at arrival. Excellent service from the receptionist. The room was nice, but even though the hotel is quite new it allready is not maintaned to a high standard. The door between the toilet and the open bathroom could not close / did not work. We did not mention it as a complaint because of the free upgrade. The rooms lacks in general space for clothes, shoes etc. and things like an iron and ironing board. Else the room is quite good and nicely decorated. The breakfast was okay to the price but nothing special and not what you normally get at a 4 star hotel. The spa area is nice but sometimes it gets to sexualised. That made us stay away from the nice spa area, as it is not relaxing to be in a spa where people are very directly aproaching people. If that is what the hotel wants then it is fine, but then it is not a hetero friendly hotel as it advertise to be. Even I who is gay found it a bit to much. The spa would have got 5 if it was more "family" friendly. The staff at the hotel are very friendly and the hotel is in overall quiet nice. There was a nice warm up party to the CSD parade. The things above mentioned and the value for the price makes us only give it an average score. You can get 4-5 star hotels in Berlin for same price or cheaper. Thanks for a nice stay but next time we will probebly use another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, but suite is disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Dutchguy71
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the second time in this hotel. The location is excellent next to gay bars, night life and close to the shopping streets. We had a suite this time. The first night we stayed in suite 601 which does not have a bath, is very small and does not look like a suite. According to the website of the hotel every suite has a computer, a bath etc. and this suite does not have this. The shower was too hot and we could not switch it to colder. The airco was not working so for the amount we paid it was a ripoff. The second and third night we stayed in a suite on the first floor. This is much better (more space). The shower was good and we could adjust the water. Only negative thing about the shower is that the bathroom becomes wet because of the dooropening. Last time we stayed in a junior suite and now in a suite. To be honest I do not know the differences. Normally a suite is bigger, but in this case the size is the same. Next time I will book a jr. suite again as I could not see any difference. I missed a safebox in the room. Bed is comfortable. Internet is €9 for 24 hours. It does not work fast and connection is cancelled if you do not use Internet for 30 minutes, so you have to log in every time. The spa area is small for a hotel of this size. The black walls, ceiling etc. need to be repainted on some parts as you can see the white colour of the stones.

Reviews.Title: “Creepy, frustrating”
Reviews.Author: Acjp
Reviews.Content: This hotel left a bad impression. Far frow what it proposes and advertises. Carpets on corridors were smelly. Black floor, walls and ceiling are ugly, but worse than it, they (try to) conceal poor cleaning. Lots of dust. Shower box left liters of water spill all over bathroom's floor. Air conditioning didn't work, in hottest summer ever. Internet wi-fi didn't worked either. Part of the staff was unfriendly, and got cocky when facing our complaints. Windows in front of bathroom open over the street, with no blind or curtains, so at night in room you unexpectedly learn how a window-girl from Amsterdam's Red Light District feels like. Room cleaning service left things (personal included) in strange places. That was creepy and forced us to check-out in the same day. Practical example of how to ruin an interesting proposal of gay welcoming accomodation. If this hotel bankrupts like it seems it is going to, none will miss it.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and location!”
Reviews.Author: Jugernuts
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here earlier this month and loved it. We had a junior suite and thought the room was great. Very clean. Very helpful and friendly staff. Will definitely stay here again next time we are in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Good location great breakfast small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Kiwiinmotion
Reviews.Content: The room was a bit small for two. Not helped by the water from the shower escaping into the bathroom causing a small flood. Should not be too hard to get the shower floor to slope in the right direction. The dining room is great with a good breakfast selection and outdoor terrace. One quibble is plugs. For an international hotel either get sockets which can cope with, say, the standard of 3 major sources of visitors or have converters available to loan or even for sale if too many 'disappear' when the guest checks out

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HIP HOTEL in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: dkliman
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for gay or straight traveler, Hetro welcoming is their motto and any hip traveler will feel right in groove there. Steps from KaDeWe (Berlin's Bloomingdales or Harrods)' cool cafes and restaurants all around and U-Bahn also steps away....LOVED corner suite 501 with huge windows and semi circular bedroom with walls of glass. Super cool bathroom too. Professional staff in all areas (Alexa, front office manager ROCKS!) Breakfast in the garden NOT TO BE MISSED. Nice roof top gym and great roof terrace. Excellent value for money, HIGHLY RECOMMENDED especially for male gay travelers looking for hip gay upscale (but not deluxe) hotel in the one of Berlin's most convenient and coolest neighborhoods. Wireless Internet works really well in all areas of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well appointed rooms with great views”
Reviews.Author: godmarks
Reviews.Content: Thanks for a very nice stay in Berlin. Great bed, great pillows and very friendly and helpful staff, my 2nd stay at an Axel hotel and would not hesitate in recommending

Reviews.Title: “the best place 4 gays, at the best location!!”
Reviews.Author: yarin43
Reviews.Content: this amazing hotel suggest 3 important things: very good rooms, very wolcomeing+kinnd stuff, and the best locatuon 4 tourist, speciali 4 gay people!!!! this is my 7th(!!) visit at this hotel, and i'm sure thaht it's not the last wan!! my advice: if you have any problem, dont hesitate to tell stuff. in my last visit i had a small problem with the safe, and all the stuff try 2 help me, even the general manneger arrived speciali from is own home!!

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: mcwilliam32
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend ( Fri-Mon). Hotel: Perfect location in Berlin Schöneberg. Bars, Restaurants, Museums and Shopping all within a few mintues walk of the hotel. Black is the theme colour of this hotel - from the facade, the reception, the corridors and finally wall colours of the rooms. Room: Buenos Aires Junior Suite: Located on the 2nd floor facing a main thoroughfare. Bedroom/Bathroon are divided by a paper thin wall with an incorporated tainted glass partition - No door seperating them. The room is designed to impress and indeed it does at first. However, after 3 days a use a series of functional disparities came to light and should be redressed by the management. Positive: Very comfortable double bed. Bath with Jacuzzi function, Bang & Olafson telephone. Wonderful high-tech shower unit (unfortunately it only worked for one day of our visit - the technican had the weekend off). Negative: - The "wardrobe" is not a wardrobe in the classical sense and appears to be there for design purpose and nothing more. We had 4 "hanger" options per person and these were extremely tight. In other words, you can hang 4 shirts each and nothing else. There are no hangers for coats, trousers etc. - The toilet . there is no door seperating the bathroom from the toilet - The bathroom - design malfunction. Again it looks great at first but the lacks functionality. No room to comfortablly store your toiletries properly. No hangers (favourtie subject) for towels. No hair Hair dryer stand. Shower door didnt close properly with a resulting small flood. The walls could do with a touch of paint! Breaksfast: Excellent. Broad and varied assortment of fresh food. Staff: Very friendly and helpful at all times. Fazit: I would stay at this hotel again but only in a suite. I had a look at the standard rooms and they were too small and "boxy" for two people. The hotel was designed to please the eye and it does. However, in his/her hurry to impress the Architect / Interior Designer forgot some very basic rules that apply to hotels everywhere - functionality

Reviews.Title: “Better thn expected”
Reviews.Author: Stuart80
Reviews.Content: Just stazed here for a long weekend Thurs-Sunday and we couldnt fault the place at all. The rooms were great, the location is great and food is great. The hotel is central to everything youll need in Berlin and is easily located too. We booked this months ago have both been looking forward to travelling here and was not disappointed. Very highly recommended. We won the Lovin Axel Cities competition for Berlin and weve chosen to visit the Axel in Barcelona for our prize and were looking forward to that even more now that we have stayed here. One slightly negative comment though guys would be the jacuzzi......It needs to be warmer than it was this weekend. Far to cold to enjoy it being outside when outside was a little cold too in the evening. Apart from that GREAT!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel, Great location...”
Reviews.Author: BigdogsTX
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner were visiting for Easter Weekend from the US and were staying a week so we decided to get a little extra room and chose the Junior Suite. The room was good sized for a European hotel. Very stylish and interesting design. Since we were there for the nightlife we especially appreciated the blackout curtains and double pained windows. The bathroom well equipped but the shower tended to flood the rest of the bathroom if you weren't careful where you directed the spray. I decided to try the gym but some of the equipment was broken so I wound up at a fitness center the staff recommended a few blocks away. The staff was extremely helpful, I can't stress this enough. We have some special requests that typically european hotels give us exasperated looks when we make (extra pillows, Ice for the room) but the staff at the Axel were very quick to make us happy . Diego and Kevin at the front desk were especially helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better!”
Reviews.Author: ATLluxury
Reviews.Content: I had not been to Berlin in over 15 years and wanted to return to see all the changes. Wow, what an eye opener. The Axel was a great choice for me in that it was in the middle of everything including the KaDeWe. The design of the hotel is very nice and cutting edge. The rooms were very comfortable and had everything that was needed for the stay. I cannot say enough good things about the staff. Chris and Diego on the desk were always so accomodating with great smiles all the time. Lots going on while I was there, but nothing seemed to ruffle their great spirits. If one likes to party in the neighborhoood, home is only a few steps away after all the great beer. Lots of great restaurants within one block of Axel. I look forward returning to the Axel on my next trip to Berlin!!

Reviews.Title: “Second visit - still pretty good !”
Reviews.Author: Banlon1964
Reviews.Content: Great location, nicely appointed rooms, and friendly staff. We stayed here two years ago and weren't scheduled to come back on a recent trip but when our other hotel turned out to be a dump, we found a very good deal online and came back to the Expedia. The place can feel a little sterile and boringly trendy but it's very comfortable. One bad point : wifi access costs 9 Euros per 24 hours. This is not cool...it feels very 1997 for a hotel that wants to be hip !

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Br00ksey
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a three night stay in the Axel Hotel Berlin. I booked a superior room for my stay which on arrival was disappointing. I was told that the room is the same size as a standard room but has a jacuzzi bath. It was small, particularly the bathroom. It took all of about two minutes to decide on paying the extra for a Junior Suite. The space in the Junior Suite was much more comfortable. The rooms would be your worst cleaning nightmare at home. They are definately chic with black featuring throughout the room and the bed was incredibly comfortable. The shower leaks water all over the bathroom but there were quite a few towels in the room that could be used to mop it up. The cleaning is not great. We found a sock belonging to someone else caught up below the curtain and the black obviously shows up all the missed areas. The black is not an excuse though ... the window at the end of the fourth floor corridor was absolutely dust ridden and makes you wonder if that level of attention manifests elsewhere in the hotel? Breakfast at the hotel was over priced for what was availble and with just one waiter and the cook the buffet went unstocked as more guests arrived to eat. I would suggest going out locally for breakfast. There is plently to chose from. I never ate dinner at the hotel. I did go into the restaurant on one evening but as there was no staff on hand again we decided to eat out instead. Without doubt the best thing about this hotel is the location. It is excellently located for the underground system as the station is about a five minute walk across the road and the main sights are a very short journey away. The station is in a wonderful square with excellent restaurants and shops. I would recommend breakfast at the cake shop on the left as you enter the square. The cakes are good too! I am a fitness fanatic so it was useful to have a fitness facility at the hotel. A treadmill, cross trainer, bike and weights were satisfactory to maintain a regime on a short trip away. The staff at reception were very friendly and helpul. To summarise, I would say that the hotel is OK but lacks the attention to detail to make it great. It would do better if it ensured staff were always visible and on hand for guests and the cleaning needs improving. Would I recommend this hotel ... yes, with caution attached.

Reviews.Title: “Time off in Berlin with all energy, but feeling home at Axel !”
Reviews.Author: Kyle-Tyler010
Reviews.Content: ... It was my first time at Axel and travelling alone, I was looking for some time off and to recharge some energy and nothing better than Berlin. So I received the recommendation from a friend for the Axel, and I must say, it was the best hotel I've been... The services, the room, the facility of the hotel was soooo good, that I literualy felt at home. I had my same routine, of getting up, having breakfats, working out, talking to friendly people ( not only the guests but also the staff). It was great. This hotel is on my favourites, because my return to Berlin will be often and we all want to be away, but at same time feeling a bit home. Besides that, the location is perfect, with bars, restaurants, subway, bus, malls... and just 15 min away by cab from Tegel Airport. Schoneberg area is great and with walk distance to high points to the Mitte area. I will be back soon !

Reviews.Title: “Axel is simply cool!”
Reviews.Author: henri_s
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner in March 2011 for one night. This was our 2nd stay (first one was a year ago). The hotel still looks new and very stylish. Location is wonderful, close to shopping, KaDeWe department store, and nightlife. We were lucky to see very friendly staff throughout our stay and got an upgrade to a junior suite in the cylindrical area of the building on the 6th floor (highest) which was fantastic! The room had an outstanding bed and panoramic views with two small balconies. Everything was top-notch and pleasurable. Our first stay was in the city room and this room option was definitely much better! The rainshower was wonderful (even though couldn't turn the water colder for some strange reason - maybe it was broken?). Wellness was on the same floor which was practical and a great place to enjoy the outside jacuzzi after shopping in the city. We had dinner in the hotel which was great and for us reasonable priced. Internet costs 9 euros for 24hrs but worked fine in the room and hotel restaurant. The hotel seemed quite empty and you didn't get a crowded feeling at all (although it was weekend). This is a great place to stay at if you're in Berlin and looking for a stylish place near shopping and Schöneberg nightlife!

Reviews.Title: “Charm, sophistication and a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Flaneurotic
Reviews.Content: In my travels I've stayed in grand luxe hotels and not enjoyed myself nearly as much as I did at the Axel. The staff are charming and helpful (thank you, Michael and Chris!), the superior room I had was stylish (with possibly the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in) and the location perfect - minutes from the underground station and KaDaWe (not to mention Wittys, the organic wurst imbiss) and right on the edge of the gay scene. The Spa was a delightful bonus - can't wait to go back in warmer weather to use the sun terrace. The bar was a great place to relax and enjoy a drink - night after night, the bar staff couldn't have been more welcoming to my crowd of friends, both men and women, staying elsewhere. I've read some of the complaints here and they mystify me. Not enough hangers? Ask for more. Water from the shower on the bathroom floor? Put a towel down. WiFi doesn't work or seems to expensive? Go to the 2nd or 3rd floor and use the computers there - they're free. Experienced travellers know that things aren't - can't be! - perfect everywhere and every time; one learns to make the neccessary accommodation - it's not the end of the world! Relax, enjoy, and learn that the world doesn't always work exactly the way you want it to - except perhaps when you stay at home. If you're looking for a modestly priced, unpretentious and gemutlich restaurant, try Elephant one street away in Fuggerstrasse - more than kinds of schnitzel!

Reviews.Title: “OK for short stay”
Reviews.Author: CracowDanang
Reviews.Content: Location is convenient, not far from central part's of the city and only few minutes from metro station. Quiet, comfortable adn clean rooms, however the windows are a little bit to small. The spa was also nice. The front desk staff were friendly, always willing to help and always give correct information. The restaurant was not very good, the food they served was rather no tasty, better to go out for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the center of everything”
Reviews.Author: Lovestotravel191
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Very friendly and extremely helpful front desk personnel. The housekeeping services of the hotel were very poor. The room was only minimally cleaned and there were never enough clean towels left out. It could have been much cleaner. Also the housekeepers did not correctly count the items in the min-bar and had charged two items to my room (who knows, maybe they took them for their own use??). The super staff at the front desk took these off my bill without any issue.

Reviews.Title: “Axel”
Reviews.Author: Glenn_uk_11
Reviews.Content: Well recommend the Hotel Staff where nice Room was great

Reviews.Title: “My visit was for business but I will return for pleasure”
Reviews.Author: atravelbugger
Reviews.Content: The morning I arrived at The Axel Hotel, the room I'd booked wasn't yet prepared so the staff checked me in to an alternative room so I could get dressed for my meeting and in the afternoon, moved my luggage to my new room once it was ready.... I was in gay heaven! and the staff are attractive, friendly, and knowledgeable. My only complaint about this property is that I wish my stay had been for pleasure rather than business! This "hetero-friendly" 4star property is conveniently located to shops, public transport, and the local neighborhood bars. The Hotel Spa on the 6th floor is a great place to relax after a long day with fantastic views of the city. My bedroom was nicely appointed with a very sexy jacuzzi bath tub. I can't wait to return to Berlin for my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good designed hotel in very good location”
Reviews.Author: Shine43
Reviews.Content: It was our second stay at the Axel Hotel Berlin. We like the area, it is close to the Kudamm and in the opposite from the KADEWE. Couple of Bars and god restaurants around the hotel.Metrostation Wittenberplatz with connection to Mitte and the Eastpart just 2 minutes in walking distance. The rooms are nice and the bed is really comfortable. The service of the staff is amazing there are always trying to make everything possible. Coming back for the Gaypride in June.

Reviews.Title: “VERY gayfriendly ;-) Great service, great area.”
Reviews.Author: doerak1
Reviews.Content: A hotel with everything you want with extra`s. Original design from bottom to top. Clean rooms, hot powerful shower, jacuzzi and easy to reach lightswitches at the right places. One word: Comfortable. Location could`t be better. Subway nearby so you can travel to all places you want without walking miles. Gayarea around the corner with bars, coffeeplaces, shops and clubs. Don`t go for anything less I`d say. I`ll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Over-designed poor quality rooms saved only by good service”
Reviews.Author: Sackville
Reviews.Content: I'm sure that when the hotel was first completed everything looked chic and smart and everyone felt great about how the design of this hotel was out of the norm. The problem is that as it is getting older, the rooms are looking tired and the ambient noise in the hallways is just so loud you can barely get any sleep. I stayed in a suite and that was small so goodness knows what the standard rooms look like, but the suite I had was getting tired and had not been cleaned particularly well. Couple that with having to keep the window curtains closed at the risk of offending passers by when you are nothing but fully dressed and you soon begin to realise that the practicalities were considered only after the designer had his little joke of making the room(s) resemble a Rococo Bordello. Do yourself a favour - pick somewhere more upmarket - you probably deserve it, and at the prices these guys charge, you can probably afford it!

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: victoria_knight2
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband booked here because there was a great deal on the room price. We knew it was in the centre of the gay district, so went with an open mind. We were greated with nothing but the best customer service from the staff and the room was excellent. he staff even went on the internet for us, to help translate some information about the historical city. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Fantastic. Thankyou for making our stay in the great city of Berlin memoriable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic gay boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: wirralbret
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here on two occasions. The location of the hotel was excellent. The quality and cleanliness of the rooms was also very good. However the breakfast was a little poor. The spa on the rooftop terrace was very romantic. However, we didn't find this until the last day of the trip so we made use of this on our second visit. Maybe the staff should make guests aware of their fitness suite and jacuzzi when they check in. It wasn't a cheap venue to stay in, but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: SteNpton
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for a long weekend and we weren't disappointed. The hotel is just a 2 min walk from Wittenburgplatz Underground. We were greeted by the lovely Chris who checked us in efficiently. We had a room on the 5th floor and we couldn't fault it - very different but gave us what we wanted, which was a nice big comfy bed and a great shower... i've noticed that some people have said about the lack of storage space available, but it wasn't too bad. The breakfast was great - enough continental choice plus a couple of hot items. The only gripe we would say is that the spa area needs a bit more attention - the sauna wasn't as hot as it could be some days, and the whirlpool, whilst in a great open air location, just wasn't warm enough to stay in (even though it was freezing cold outside!), plus would strongly recommend rubber mats on the steps to stop people slipping as it was extremely icy out there one night... Well done Axel, ensure you keep your customers satisfied with your pleasant "can do" manner, and you will ensure that many people, like us, will return and stay with you when they next come to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for gay-centric Schoenberg”
Reviews.Author: matt4867
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Axel hotel twice now. Both times I chose it because of it's ideal location and proximity to many of the most popular gay shops, restaurants and nightlife. I have read many of the reviews about this hotel, and can understand why some find the rooms unusual, but in my opinion, that is likely the intent of the place... to be "different." It is true... the rooms are quite modern, and (to some) likely a bit of a challenge to get used to, but I kinda like it. To coin a phrase from the distant past... they're "groovy." From my experiences, the rooms have always been nice, clean, and comfortable. Trust me, I would report otherwise if not true. The other thing to note is the staff. On both occasions, the front desk staff performed brilliantly. Someone was always there, always willing to lend advice, help, service or to call a cab. A special shout out goes to one staff member specifically, named Frank. He was awesome! Again, if you are gay and you want to b close to the lovely neighborhood of Schoenberg and you appreciate unusual/modern design as well as attentive and stylish service, then you can't go wrong here. if you are looking for a standard hotel that is no different than anything else out there, then you may want to look elsewhere. I will certainly return again. Hopefully sooner than later ;)

Reviews.Title: “Black rooms and stylish, but not practical! Friendly staff, but no service!”
Reviews.Author: swisspigs
Reviews.Content: We stayed various times at the Axel Hotel because it is very centrally located and we often got a very good rate. Now, what you should know is that this hotel is new and the architect obviously won the competition over the sense of practicability. There is only very little room to store your things, the shower is very nice, but complicated to use and the water flows out of the shower cabinet as the floor is flat. The beds are very, very comfortable and you will have an excellent sleep. This is also helped by the fact that the rooms (as well as almost the whole house) is painted black! The welcome is very friendly, but we had two things to complain (the safe did not work and the temperature selector in the big shower only moved a little bit and not to the extent possible). Our complaint was noted on a little piece of paper, but has never been dealt with. And this was not the first time that this happened to us in this hotel. Overall, we had very mixed feelings about the Axel, but decided not to stay there anymore for the many little things which do not work for us.

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL if your GAY”
Reviews.Author: TheMeanMachine
Reviews.Content: hotels was nice, but I didnt read the reviews and therefore when I got there with a work collegue I was shocked to find out it was a hotel for gay people. So as you can have imagined very awkard...

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel, but not a 4 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: tomersi
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend stayed at Axel hotel from the 31/12/2010 until the 04/01/2011 I'll start with the good things: The Hotel is very very good located. The hotel staff is very nice, very polite and very helpful. The rooms and the hotel are clean and very nice. Now for the *not so good* things…: We stayed in a "city room" It's a 4 star hotel, there should be a closet… The room is very small. There is no mini bar in the room. The bathroom and the toilet are together and….. *************They are wide open!!! *************** With a big windows so, when you are seating in the toilet, you are exposed. I'm sorry but for me, it's too much. There must be curtain, MUST. Other then that, the hotel is recommended. Tomer.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: Josullivan1
Reviews.Content: My Room stank, the smell was very obviously coming from the shower drain. I notified staff in a friendly and straightforward manner to which I got a blank face and no help. They didn't suggest to change my room for another they didn't apologize. nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, OK location.”
Reviews.Author: dee_jay_ay
Reviews.Content: I was expecting a gay hotel to be a dodgy B&B with a dodgy old man behind the counter, so I was vert pleasantly surprised by the Axel. It was clear, modern and well appointed. The staff were professional and helpful. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff, cool rooms and easy access to get around town”
Reviews.Author: javierboston
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were visiting Berlin for the first time, and we booked the Axel because friends had stayed there and liked it. Our room was not ready when we arrived (we had booked a superior room) and they upgraded us to a junior suite, which was a lot of fun. The hotel is high design on a budget, and is showing a little wear and tear. We would definitely stay there again in Berlin, primarily because it is a gay hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Could do better with cleaning”
Reviews.Author: Adsandkev
Reviews.Content: Great room and well located hotel. The staff in general were welcoming and very helpful although a bit stretched early evening and did not always answer the phone quickly. Great room well thought out and plenty of space and wonderful bed. The spa area was nice, small but well laid out, hot tub could do with being a bit hotter! The real downside was the cleaning of the room, complained twice about the poor housekeeping standards in the bathroom, watermarks, smears on mirrors, lime-scale, light bulbs not changed, just generally poor housekeeping,. It did improve after our first compliant but not to the sort of standard i would expect at this price level. The duty manager explained that they sourced out the housekeeping and that it was a new company, well they need to up their game.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: VLAXKAMEX
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. It is not 5 star and if you can get the suite it is worth the little extra. Staff are fantastic restraint is good and the location is the best. The hotel was fully booked and at all times the staff could not help enough. Thank you from 2 boys from Australia for making our stay a fantastic one! Ps shopping in Berlin is amazing. Best in Europe,

Reviews.Title: “Very good service:-)”
Reviews.Author: dk-trips
Reviews.Content: Axel hotel in Berlin is a good,clean, and basic design hotel.The staff in reception was VERY NICE to us! We also wrote with the hotel before coming, and they very so fast to answer us and they did arrange two rooms next to each other as we asked for:-) So they staff were brilliant!!!! BUT I am not sure about the rooms.....We had two rooms and one of them were in perfect conditions, but the other was really bad.The toilet door was broken,telephone was not working and carpet had LOTS of stains on it....If you book with them just make sure that the room you get is nice, since there is a big difference in the room standard, and look forward to a very NICE service from the staff:-) NOTE: Axel hotel is homo friendly and WE LOVED IT:-) I were travelling with 3 teenagers:-)So just book it..... EVERYONE feels welcome in the hotel:-)

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gaytravel10
Reviews.Content: The location was excellent. The sauna facilities were good. Nice roof top terrace and spa. Good breakfast and service. A very friendly experience. The beds were excellent. Great location for the gay bars and gay street parties and close to public transport. Smart and clean for a gay hotel. I liked the style of the hotel

Reviews.Title: “I loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: Zack33
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 10 nights in September. This is the first Axel Hotel I have stayed in and I loved it! The whole design of the hotel is very chic...not like the usual run of the mill hotel! Location is awesome - several great gays bars 100 metres away (Prinzknecht being one of them!) and great eating establishments close by. Staff were extremely helpful. I thought the 'Please disturb' signs were cute...not that I had a need to use them but if you were a single gay traveller looking for in-house action, it would be very possible! On the whole, my husband and I thoroughly enjoyed it and would have no hesitation recommending it to anyone - gay or otherwise!

Reviews.Title: “Better than the average gay hotels”
Reviews.Author: engam
Reviews.Content: I have often avoided gay hotels because of poor room quality and services. Axel had shown that reasonable standard could be achieved. However, there were still some areas that needed improvement. The Wifi signal in my room was non existent. I was therefore forced to use the only 2 free guest computers on Level 2 and 3. They were always used by someone, including children. Waiting was a pain. I arrived on a Sunday evening, and wanted to get something to eat in the restaurant, but was told they only served drinks there. One night at 12 midnight, I asked the reception where I could find a can of cola, and was told everywhere was closed, and there was none in the hotel. I found out later for myself that there was a bottle of coke in my in room mini bar. I was in a Junior suite. The room size was similar to that of a standard room in other hotel. I inspected the standard rooms in Axel and they were really small. On a positive note, the staffs were generally friendly and spoke English. The hotel is in a good location next to a metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Near luxury at motel price.”
Reviews.Author: Luc43
Reviews.Content: We were floored by the quality of the hotel and amenities given the very reasonable rates of this hotel. It is not perfect: 1) walls are painted black which makes the rooms very dark and appear smaller, 2) while central enough and close to the Ku'damm we might prefer to stay in the younger hipper Prenzlauer neighbourhood the next time we go to Berlin, 3) the cleaning staff woke us up for fun (they were laughing when they opened the door) and ended up not doing our room the last nite. However we found the hotel and room beautiful and well appointed (they even have a backyard with tables and lawn and a beaut. spa) in comparison to the price. We had spent the first night at the nearby hotel Castor the Vine which was absolutely fine but could not compare in space, style and amenities. One more point to note about the Axel hotel though is that wireless internet was Euro 9 per day, otherwise they are 2 computers available for all, definitely not enough but better than many places that claim to have free wireless (my experience around the world is it never works well or at all).

Reviews.Title: “Will probably not return”
Reviews.Author: JMX2016
Reviews.Content: The rooms are so small it is virtually not possible to open a suitcase. The shower is big but there is no step beween the shower and the bathroom so the water went on the bathroom floor and further on the room carpet. Not possible to stop. Ridiculous The amenities in the bathroom are not replaced automaticly if used. As well as the towels we let on the floor. We bad to run after the maid. The aircon/heating was not working. To be set on 5 or 30 the same air temperature gets out of the ventilation. The television was a joke. Many channels did not work. Thet advertize to have 4 tv channels in french for example but noone was available on the canals thet were supposed to be. I signaled it to the frontdesk which didnt seem to be concerned at all. The location is good though and most of the staff is nice and friendly I will probably not return to Axel hotel unless they offer a reallly good deal

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here for 3 nights , upon arrival...”
Reviews.Author: Irishgaycouple
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights , upon arrival was told the suite we had booked 6 months in advance was not available. Only option offered was there superior room , which we found to be very small , no view, All amenities were there as listed but all in a very confined space. Thestaff and food in restaurant were good. But will never stay here again. Very poor for anew holel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlisoTraveler
Reviews.Content: To begin, this hotel is "Hetero-Friendly" and they advertise that with the shirts they wear. If you have a problem with gay people, it's best to look elsewhere. The hotel rooms are nice and large by European standards. The shower is nice, they use Villeroy and Boch sinks, Bang & Olufsen phones. Everything is in black, and the counter top for the bathroom sink had been damaged upon installation or by another customer. The screws had started coming up through the bottom. It didn't bother me, just something I noticed. The BIGGEST complaint that I have is the fact that they charge 9 Euro for internet services. This is HORRIBLE and the first that I've come across in Europe. I'm sure there are other hotels that charge, but I happened to stay at this one and I think it's ridiculous! That's the only hit that I would give this hotel. Other than that, things are good for a solo traveler or a couple. One note...if you're traveling with friends, this may not be the place. There is no privacy for the shower from inside the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ATLTRVLGUY
Reviews.Content: Was kind of worried before going to this hotel due to a couple of reviews on here.....however was surprised!! I did get a very good rate which made this hotel a great deal. Hotel is well located close to nightlife and transportation. You can shop, sightsee, and experience Berlin from this one location (even nightclubs and other sights on other side of city were easy to reach on u-bahn). The breakfast was great and spa area nice to relax after a long day. All of the people working at this hotel were great but Dieago (SP?) was the best. He worked in the breakfast area and bar area in the evening. He was always friendly and working hard to make the guest's stay a good one. As always free internet would have been a great plus.....it would have been great to help plan nights out, etc. However, they do have two free computers and it was usually easy to get on one.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Paudie_10
Reviews.Content: Great location & great hotel but a lil bit overpriced, everything is on your doorstep and staff are friendly & professional especially the cleaning lady she was lovely, the only thing I would suggest to people thinking about booking this hotel is that it seems to be for the older gay gentleman as the place was riddled with them & not for the 20-30's, but overall brilliant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, staff was incredibly helpful”
Reviews.Author: Dsimons2201
Reviews.Content: Couldnt ask for a better location and everyone at the front desk was very helpful. Room (I had a Jr Suite) was great, once I figured out where all the light switches were. I'd only ask for free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “My German holidays at Axel Hotel.... the best in a long time...”
Reviews.Author: romanforest
Reviews.Content: Who wouldn't dream of spending one week in a suite of a ****Hotel in Berlin ? Well, I got that chance with my best friend and I must confess...we had a fantastic time. The Axel Hotel where we stayed, very nearby Berlin's Gay area, offered us the best service we had in a long time. The room was absolutely stunning ! The breakfast was amazing as well as the food on the menu and the staff was amazingly friendly. What else could we have asked for ? Two plasma Tv, a personal computer with internet, a gym and a Spa.... that does it all for me. We even got the chance to meet the manager to thank him in person... a delicious man. Frankly, if you want to share a nice time in a nice hotel, don't hesitate ! Thanks a lot to the staff for being so nice and for anticipating all our needs so well.

Reviews.Title: “Personalized Service!”
Reviews.Author: dubaidoro
Reviews.Content: I was staying whilst traveling on business. I have travelled many times to Berlin and usually stayed at the Adlon or the Ritz, which obviously offer the usual classic and conservative service. After experiencing the individual service at Axel, I will certainly come back to this hotel. The staff has been extraordinarily nice! From the GM down to the recepetionist everybody treadted me as if I am an old friend. Even though it seemed to me that the hotel is a bit understuffed all employees were putting in the extra effort to ensure I was enjoying my stay. Thanks again Axel Team!

Reviews.Title: “Good in theory...”
Reviews.Author: scottyonthego
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Axel for a nearly one week trip in August. Will highlight good and then not good: Good *good central location (2 blocks from major metro line and close to lots of bars and restaraunts (especially all the gay bars in Schoenberg) *hotel and rooms offer nice design, very modern, dark and masculine *tub has jacuzzi jets (i'm not a tub guy but would be nice if you were) *Chris at front desk was very nice and helpful Not Good *The Hotel is located on a very busy street (almost highway like) and my room faced street so i wouldn't recommend that - book a room facing the interior courtyard) *Even if you have your do not disturb card on your door, they have this stupid policy that if you haven't left your room by 2pm so they can clean it that they then call you and if you don't answer they open your room to check on you. WTF. Berlin is a late city...I don't need a mother to check on me while I'm on vacation. They stop cleaning rooms by 3pm...a little early by my liking *They allowed a film company to take over most of the rooms on my floor and shoot a porn in the halls, etc...annoying (well maybe it would have been less annoying if the porn stars were hot...but they weren't so it was annoying) *the kitchen is effecitvely closed...they have signs posted that the kitchen is only open thurs-sunday - i guess this is due to the fact they don't do enough business...but it gives the "public" spaces a very empty feeling *Charging for WiFi. In todays era when you can get free WiFi at a coffee shop across the street and everywhere else, hotels that still charge (and 9 euro a day) for it seem out of touch. Also don't you hate it when a hotel lists WiFi as one of the room ammenities but they don't mention you have to pay for it? Me too! *the worst part was the front desk guy Luis. He had such a sour attitude. when i checked in he seemed almost like I was bothering him. Being as it was my first time in Berlin I asked his recommendations as to where to go out that night (bars, clubs, etc.) he basically shrugged and said there wasn't anything good that night (really? thanks so much). Another time I saw him at the front desk and I said "Hi Luis, how are you?", his reply "I could be better". I mean really is that the guy you want as the front man to your hotel greeting guests. It's my vacation you should at least fake it and tell me "Everything is great, how is your day?" If you want to keep Luis on your staff you should move him back to the computer programming room or something - he is bad for business.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: Frenchybcn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Axel hotel for 6 nights in july, the room was lovely, very nice view, very confortable. The breakfast buffet was delicious, the staff was very friendly, lovely view from the sky bar on the 6th floor. Very close to the gay area and the Ubahn station. I'll definitely go back there! (-:

Reviews.Title: “Only if you need to be right next to a bunch of gay bars”
Reviews.Author: saudoso
Reviews.Content: If you want the convenience of being in an all gay hotel a few blocks away from a bunch of gay cruising bars and clubs, then go for it. Otherwise, I wouldn't recommend it. The axel tries to be a luxury designer hotel but falls short on practical details and comfort. The room was so cramped there was no space for two suitcases. The all black bathroom was about the worst design idea ever. The toilet was in a tiny stall with sliding door painted totally black with a glaring spotlight-- claustrophobic? Plus all the black really shows dust, splashes, and water marks, making the room and bath look dirtier than it probably is-- must be twice the work to clean it. If this is your first time in Berlin, I'd recommend staying in the north Mitte neighborhood instead- more restaurants, more sights, more diversity. But if you already know Berlin and want to stay in this neighborhood, I'd suggest looking at better hotels in the area, especially the Ellington which seemed super nice.

Reviews.Title: “A triumph of style over practicality”
Reviews.Author: Peter Mills
Reviews.Content: The Axel Hotel is very new and has obviously been sandwiched on quite a tight plot. As a result it is a bit cramped and the rooms are almost uncomfortably small. We had a 'superior room' which was not exactly large, so goodness knows what a standard or single room must be like! They have tried to make the hotel seem larger with an extensive use of black walls and mirrors, in fact they are everywhere and they can be a bit disconcerting after a late night! It all looks very 'designer' which is what they think urban queens like, but comfort and practicality are also appreciated. The rooms have a ridiculously small amount of storage space (bring your own hangers as you only get three per person) and there are very few cupboards or drawers, presumably as this would spoil the chi-chi desiger space - again a triumph of style over practicality. We stayed in a double room and yet they only provide one dressing gown and one pair of slippers. The rooms are generally quiet (thanks to the drone of the air conditioning masking background noise) and the beds comfortable. However, doors slam at all hours. Why couldn't they install doors that close quietly? The gym and spa were OK, but didn't seem to be serviced very well - no water or cups on a couple of occasions and no air conditioning. The breakfast was good quality, but over priced, particularly if you haven't booked it in advance. There are much cheaper places to eat down the road, including 'Windows' restaurant where you can get a huge breakfast at a fraction of the cost. The best thing about the Axel is the location. It is only a modest walk from the U-bahn station to get into the centre and it is close to the heart of the Shoneberg gay district, which has a wonderfully relaxed feel to it. Several bars are literally just a staggering distance away, together with many good restaurants. The staff at the Axel are mostly friendly and helpful and hotel is clean. It is clearly mostly gay but there were a couple of straight families when we were there. If it were a little bit less self consiously 'stylish' and paid a bit more attention to comfort then it would be a great hotel, as it is it is fine for a short break, but staying a week like we did is pushing it.

Reviews.Title: “NO A/C.....great location.”
Reviews.Author: GaryToronto
Reviews.Content: Great location. Expensive for a hotel with no working air conditioning. Website says AC but desk staff says environmentally friendly AC. Room never got below 28c, even at night! Interesting "suite" layout. Bedroom, bathroom and a desk nook. Rooms listed as having internet, additional charge not mentioned on website.

Reviews.Title: “Informal Gay Quasi 4 star Hotel Lacking that certain something”
Reviews.Author: Ronaldjp
Reviews.Content: If you are gay and want to be smack in the centre of most of the Gay goings on in Berlin then this 3-4 star hotel is for you. If you are not Gay...thats OK also as even the staff walk around with T shirts inscribed with "Hetero Friendly" as if to convince everybody else. On arrival nobody to help with the bags , and we had 2 heavy ones, and a rather off hand receptionist, in this new Hotel and our requests before hand for a disabled access room near the lift with extra pillows were ignored. A sign of bad front office management.. . The rooms are small , mosty done in black , typically architect-who-have-never-slept-in-a-hotel-but -is hip rooms! No place whatsoever to open a suitcase unless you dirty the bed with it or balance it on your knees... Bed OK comfort wise.. but extremely slippery shower floors in a small bathroom which forms part of the room . The shower itself in excellent , however, along with the towels and amenities which are fine. Good flat screen TV but it drives you nuts as they try and sell you ,at ridiculous prices , all sorts of other "entertainment" before you finally get to the TV part and then its very difficult once there flicking from one channel to another. Room is somewhat gloomy and when asking for a small mreading light they refused...that alone will make me never return or recommend, in addition to the rather noisy room corridors and hugely annoying constant door slamming. Friendly breakfast waiters and a hearty German breakfast with many goodies. The best goodie of all is that on weekends breakfast is served until 2 pm YES! Thats the best deal of all in this rather mediocre hotel but if you are Gay you certainly wont have far to walk to ogle and toggle.

Reviews.Title: “Poorly run hotel - stay away from it”
Reviews.Author: JeanPierreBrighton
Reviews.Content: The hotel website suggests an elegant hotel with a taste of luxury. What I experienced is a poorly run hotel offering little comfort. Staff were particularly unhelpful. Check in experience very average. When I called reception asking for an ironing board, I was told none was available at the time and was not offered any alternative. Later called as I could not find an English channel on TV, was told by reception staff "If you have not found it means there are none.." The hotel is promoting itself as "heterofriendly", it should change it to "NOT friendly whatsover". Sleep comfort was horrible. I travelled with my partner and our double room had two single beds put together. Mattresses were of bad quality. The hotel promises IPod On Stage speakers in all rooms but you actually have to request reception for it. They are not standard in all rooms. Our rooms had only one bathrobe and one pair of slippers. Wifi is charged at EUR 9.00 per day whereas most hotels now offer this free of charge. I was conscious that other hotels would deliver better value for money but was hoping for a good experience, overall Axel hotel does not deliver, stay away from it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: Pourquoipasdonc
Reviews.Content: Very sympathic place, rooms are clean, breakfeast is wonderfull, staff is quite smiling

Reviews.Title: “Funky hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: 186605Annie
Reviews.Content: As female guests on our first visit to Berlin we were delighted to find the male staff on reception went out of their way to recommend "lady friendly" nightspots and restaurants. (On our first night of the trip we had mistakenly relied upon out of date websites which guided us to a lesbian bar which in fact had since closed down and re-opened as a trans bar where we were stared at until we finished one drink and left! ) Moral of the story - local knowledge is invaluable. We found the female staff unfriendly almost to the point of hostility and assumed it might be a cultural difference until we met loads of friendly people on the scene. Inexplicable. The rooms are small and not for guests who are not intimately acquainted - but they are well equipped except for the notable absence of a mini-bar and an iron - and EVERYTHING costs extra. Wi fi is a basic these days for paying quests, but not here. The atmosphere is stylish if a bit lacking in vibe due to the invisibility of other guests in the bar and restaurant - but was compensated for in the bar by a charming barman who was delighted to surprise my partner with a glass of champagne on the stroke of midnight of her birthday. And the location couldnt be better - 5 mins from the main shopping street, close to lots of cool restaurants and quiet at night. Will definitely go back sometime but will opt for a suite next time as the smaller rooms are only acceptable for putting your head down.

Reviews.Title: “Nice gay hotel close to gay bars and the shopping area!”
Reviews.Author: Vendelbo
Reviews.Content: Nice gay hotel close to the gay bars within a few minutes walking distance and just beside the most famous shopping center in the city. Ka De Wee! A shopping center with shops like Hugo Boss, Gucci, Armani etc.. There is also a normal shopping center just beside that one if the other one is to expensive. At christmas there is a nice christmas market in the area. At christmas I would recommend a hotel close to the tv tower instead, as most of the christmas markets is placed in that area! The hotel Park Inn, at that area is really good! But book up in a really good time as it is very populare! The rooms at Axel is of a nice quality and with a nice design. There is no wardrobe but did'nt matter for us as we normally go to Berlin just for 2-3 nights. The bathroom is best for couples as there is red glass walls so you can virtually see when your partner og friend is, at the toilet! But it did not matter for us as I shared the room with my partner. They have a really nice semi outdoor jacuzzi at the top of the hotel with a great view and so nice when you have walked around Berlin for a whole day to relax there at the evening! There is also a sauna and fitness area! This hotel is meant for gay people and their friends but straight people are also welcome! If you go as a straight then it is just very important you do not have any problems with being together with gay people :>) And those who stayed that where straight told us they had a fun time, at the hotel! At some evenings they have a draq dinner evening with a live singer also and what a fun evening! The best evening in Berlin for many times! They where so fun the singer and draq and we where really entertained while dining a nice meal! An unforgettable evening. The hotel is recommendable if you go for partying at the gay area and/or a shopping trip! If you go for cultural sights and the christmas markets choose a hotel near the TV tower instead like Park Inn! But definately best gay hotel in town and of a high standard and fair prices!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but probably not the best at this price in this area”
Reviews.Author: bbrun75
Reviews.Content: - Room decoration too dark, all the design was black, it put in relief every single dust in the room. the atmosphere was a bit cold and unpersonal. No place enough to put your clothes (just an open closet) A very high step to access the bathtub No mini bar + Excellent location with direct subway station to the main monuments of Berlin Very calm rooms

Reviews.Title: “Bet value, best place and best fun”
Reviews.Author: cileParis
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the most pleasant part of Berlin. It's in the middle of the gay area, and being a hetero friendly hotel it's position is very appealing to gay visitors of a city that has a vibrant gay scene. But, the most important fact is that it's a good, high standar hotel tout court. Very relaxed atmosphere, late breakfasts that on Saturday and Sunday are till 2 pm and a great spa that is opened till late at night make this hotel a unique choice in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Axel in Barcelona is better”
Reviews.Author: MeMartin
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and different. Modern and designer like. The staff were very nice and helpful. The rooms were quite small but rather enough. The double bed had two separate mattreces joined together but still very comfortable. The main drawback is that the rooms were quite stuffy and it felt like a relief to get out onto the corridor. The air-con was rather weak and noisy. The shower was fantastic though-big and modern walk-in shower! I think the main difference between the Berlin Axel and Barcelona one is that there was little or no atmosphere in the Berlin Axel. It just felt like no buzz nothing happening. Maybe it was just the time we stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Heterofriendly means don't go if you're not gay”
Reviews.Author: alfalove
Reviews.Content: A great heaven place for gay people. Elegant, trendy, comfortable, in the middle of the gaynightlife of Berlin Schoenberg. Friendly staff, good service which caters for people who enjoy staying out very late (during weekend they serve breakfast until 2 pm). Although they call it heterofriendly, when I was there 100% of the guests were gaymen.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Place with a Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: cmasonh
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about the location. Two blocks from Wittenbergplatz and the U-Bahn, 5 minute walk to shopping and around the corner from my favorite Bar! Several good restaurants in the area. Rooms are on the "boutique" side (read small) yet well apportioned and designed. Great (and roomy) shower!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - no vibe hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alan096
Reviews.Content: Well equiped hotel with excellent and helpfull staff in a great location. Very modern and sexy design in black and gold (lots of elements inspired by a gay sauna) to love or hate. Small but well equped rooms (City Room ie standard room). Small but good quality breakfast. Compared to Axel Barcelona the hotel lacks vibe and and feels empty even when fully booked. The restaurant recently minimized its opening hours (only weekends now) which might contribute to the slow feel. Maybe summer time is better when the skybar is open. Stay here if you get a good deal on price otherwise there are other options.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect gay city trip hotel”
Reviews.Author: nlbelboy
Reviews.Content: A "straight friendly" hotel in the heart of Berlin's gay area. Great hotel great staff, breakfast til 2pm in the weekends. KaDeWe around the corner.Design comfort. What more do you need!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Staff...what more do you want?”
Reviews.Author: JohnAberdeen
Reviews.Content: The Axel is a very well designed hotel....the rooms are not massive but they are perfectly designed. The shower is FANTASTIC. The rooms have all the amenities you require e.g. safe, mini bar. You pay for the wi-fi in your room, but his is free in public areas. The staff are incredibly helpful and friendly..and very professional. I've stayed at the Axel several times over the last twelve months and every time has been great...I'll definitely be back. The only thing I would like the Hotel to add is a loyalty scheme to reward regular guests.

Reviews.Title: “Pulls off a seemingly impossible balancing act - gracefully”
Reviews.Author: IpanemaGuys
Reviews.Content: With their "hetero friendly" slogan and "please disturb" signs you can hang on your door (in addition to the expected 'clean this room' or 'privacy please') and location in the center of Berlin's gay neighborhood, the Axel positions itself as a spot for the luxe homo to indulge. It works. the staff is friendly, knowledgeable and prompt in responding to requests. I've traveled a lot and it was so refreshing to not have someone assume I was straight AND be at a beautiful full service hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and service”
Reviews.Author: JSP4
Reviews.Content: The facilities and services at the Axel are excellent, especially considering the rate we paid. I've stayed in much more expensive hotels that are far from offering the service we got here.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!!!”
Reviews.Author: Pichler1
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff. We had junior suite "Barcelona" and it was very nice, clean and comfortable. Hydro-massage bathtub was fantastic! But bathroom is without hooks for towels (two are little). Wellness was good, but nothing special. Breakfast was fully satisfactory and weekends until 14:00 - really great. The hotel is situated in a perfect location! Shops, restaurants and entertainment are very close. Price is slightly higher than usual, but when you catch special offer it is OK.

Reviews.Title: “lOOKS GOOD FROM THE OUTSIDE, BUT STANDARDS ----- NEEDS IMPROVING”
Reviews.Author: ORSETT66
Reviews.Content: Had trouble sleeping, u can hear everyone walking up and down the corridor, hear every door bang close. The room cleanliness was poor, sheet was not changed, room smelt horrible after returning to it after a day out, smelt like someone had had their bowels open in the room, order forms for breakfast not replaced,

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel just a couple of Gripes!”
Reviews.Author: DerbyshireTim
Reviews.Content: I wont repeat what many others have,stayed 4 nights in a junior suite which was lovely,staff all fabulous and so friendly and helpful!! Great Location,quite a few male/female couples staying aswell ,only 2 gripes i would have,next time i go i will just stay room only as the breakfast is very poor,mostly bread jam etc only 3 hot items,sausage patties,grilled tomatoes and scrambled egg(i think),the room cleaning also left alot to be desired,the bathroom floor was never washed or mopped the whole 4 days,plus the parquet floor in the room was also never swept or vacuumed! But dont let this put you off as we still loved the hotel,cant comment on the restaurant food as at the moment the restaurant only opens at weekends! Go ahead and book the hotel ,if i went back to berlin i would stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “A BLACK AND GOLD NUGGET !”
Reviews.Author: SISTEBANE
Reviews.Content: AMAZING SERVICE... in a great atmosphere ! Great quality for this young HOTEL... the rooms are spectacular, simply and really modern ! I just regret a too small JACUZZY, HAMMAM and SAUNA.. The garden is also young, but it will be great with vegetation !

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: henri_s
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly. This is a new hotel, very stylish, in Schöneberg near the bars, cafes, and KaDeWe department store. Location is very nice. Be open-minded to stay here. Rooms are nice, had a city room which was large enough for German standards. Everything was in black and gold. Rainshower with reddish glass wall is amazing! Too bad they have carpet floor (the air was bad in the room with a lot of dust). Wifi was not free but they have 2 computers in the floor. Fitness was ok, but tiny. Wellness area (spa) is nice but the sauna is not hot enough and it can get too cruisy here if you're looking for relaxation (especially on weekends). Dinner was great, enjoyed it once, wonderful wines on the menu! Breakfast is below average in hotels of this standard in Germany - and overpriced. Nearby are great alternatives for less than half of the money. Breakfast staff was nice although they ran out of many things easily (like cold cuts), and once I asked for more and got it (but hear the cook say from the kitchen "den stinknormalen Schinken???" which is quite rude meaning that does the "customer" really want the "average ham". That was annoying. The overall experience was good and I recommend this hotel to couples and citybreakers.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel, perfect service,...everything perfect”
Reviews.Author: Idrinkmate
Reviews.Content: I loved the hotel,..the room was very nice, the personell really friendly and the food and drinks were delicious,...the best bloody mary I had in years.... I definatly will come back! Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: JGGLeeds
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Axel during Fasching week (week leading up to Ash Wednesday) for 6 nights. Hotel staff very friendly and room very comfortable. Hotel seems very swanky and actually very quiet during our stay. Only fault is room lacks great space for hanging clothes (minor I know). Shower in room was great as was decor of room & hallway. Location is right beside all the good bars you should check out: dreizehn (for a traditional if somewhat bizarre experience), maxx (for bears and great happy hour prices), prinzkonnect (for the pretty boys and sexy staff) and scheune, toms and hafen only a few minutes away in Motzstrasse. Anyway back to the hotel: would recommend it and plan to return there again this year. The price also was very reasonable when booked through expedia. Enjoy it!! PS take your bathing trunks and enjoy the hottub on the top floor-is fab, or go au naturale!!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing luxury”
Reviews.Author: citytraveller34
Reviews.Content: Elegant and sexy Hotel, with service-minded staff, relaxing spa area. and comfortable rooms. Nice guests as well.

Reviews.Title: “I felt at home with my family”
Reviews.Author: AntwerpFrank
Reviews.Content: Nice atmosphere. Superclean Rooms. Trendy but not over the top. Very friendly personnel (reception, bar, restaurant, house cleaning ... everybody). always recent nice background music. Relaxing atmosphere in the hole hotel. Quiet rooms. I really felt at home.

Reviews.Title: “Long weekend in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Geoff_CLondon
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel with very good and pleasant service. I've already recommended this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant design hotel”
Reviews.Author: Planner-boy
Reviews.Content: Great design, great style. Love the top floor 'wet area' with sauna/steamroom/jacuzzi and relaxation area. Rooms are well designed - though the flaw of 'hiding' the keycard light activator is a tough one to overcome :) Service levels are brilliant and staff are incredibly friendly and welcoming. Dinner in the restaurant was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff- great location”
Reviews.Author: exportbusiness
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Axel hotel in Barcelona a couple years ago and was very curious about the new Axel hotel in Berlin. Perfect location in Schöneberg and very friendly and helpfull staff. I really enjoyed the spa and gym area as well. Free internet on 2 PCs in the hotel. The only downside may be that my room was a bit small, but ok for the price i paid

Reviews.Title: “Perfect atmosphere & location in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: LarsF
Reviews.Content: The perfect place to stay - either for business or pleasure! Comfortable bed, plenty towels, bathrobe & slippers, modern, cosy style all over. Wellness-part with ok equipment for daily exercise, high-quality showers, hamam, sauna, outdoor jacuzzi. Hereby recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Fancy something different...?”
Reviews.Author: nicole9692
Reviews.Content: Lovely,friendly staff.Asked for extra pillows...no problem and they were delivered in record time. The rooms are not over equiped with storage and you need to be very tall to reach the clothes rail! The shower experience is a unique one.....if you are rooming with someone you're not on a fairly intimate level with it could cause some blushes!! That said;it is a great place in a good location with an excellent in house restaurant and a super bar. All in all a positive experience and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice friendly hotel with superb location”
Reviews.Author: ArenaBergen
Reviews.Content: Nice staff, good beds, design hotel - and a very good location just a few mwtwers away from KaDeWa shoppingsenter.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: marc203
Reviews.Content: Nice modern place with all the necessary ammenities, enjoyed myself a lot. Quiet, nice spa area

Reviews.Title: “Unique Experience”
Reviews.Author: rwhiteleather
Reviews.Content: Despite the small single room, the hotel was a great place to stay. Once you become accustomed to the black decor, the hotel design is really very elegant. I was very comfortable and when they say that the hotel is "hetero friendly", it is really true. I felt very welcomed and at ease. I would not recommend it for anyone who is homophobic however.

Reviews.Title: “OK but...”
Reviews.Author: brusselstraveller2
Reviews.Content: I ve stayed there second time in three months. This time in teh cheapest room. Location superb. Reception - efficient and helpful. No P, C, D signs in the room. Interenet speed still VERY VERY slow. At least they shouldnt charge for it. I will try it again in May and June when on buysiness in Berlin to see if thay improved. Will keep everybody posted here. They have very comfy beds though.

Reviews.Title: “It's very nice”
Reviews.Author: bioEuropa
Reviews.Content: Service and cleanliness are very nice. The location is in the center of berlin near KA DE WE and K'damm. I think the return in this hotel for holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Very good !!!”
Reviews.Author: MacPlo
Reviews.Content: Hotel in very good location, nearly Ku`Damm. Very modern and comfortable rooms. Nice, helpfull staff...

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Axel's !!”
Reviews.Author: Mr. Matt
Reviews.Content: Having enjoyed two previous stays at the Axel in Barcelona decided to give the Berlin branch of this hotel chain a try.. OK, its really not fair to compare the Spanish vs German properties as they are based on two entirely different cultures/customs... so I won't go there. That being said.. overall enjoyed my 3 night stay in Berlin. The Front Desk Staff proved to be very accomodating. Thank you all ! Food in the restaurant was very-good and the wait /bar staff were always friendly and helpful..Room was clean, quiet and well appointed. Now the negative = the design of the room.!! The bath AREA (NOT a separate room!) SHOWER and lavatory offer no privacy what- so- ever .(There is a WC with sliding door.) So unless you are traveling solo or with someone you know VERY -WELL this may be a problem .Secondly, no space for luggage. It was explained to me that the concept here is to unpack and store your luggage in a space at the head of the bed under a shelf .. not at all convenient!!!. Would I return to Axel- Berlin ? ...YES ..as well as the Axel-Barcelona and am already looking forward to the opening of the next Axel in New York. City. .

Reviews.Title: “"Great Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: AllseasonsSathorn
Reviews.Content: Axel Hotel is a good star class hotel. It was a very pleasant and comfortable stay. Rooms were designed very modern and hip. Staffs were very friendly. It provided me a relaxing atmosphere. I enjoyed the Bar and the food in the restaurant.I may choose the same hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: FondaTravel
Reviews.Content: After reading the review on TA, I had a panic attack and wanted to canel my reservation . But after having spent a week in this hotel I can say that most of the complaints listed in previous reviews are typical 1st year problems for any hotel. Yep, the hotel is black and gold, every square inch of it, it's an aquired taste but in many eyes very chic. It's a tremendous investment in the "gayborhood" . This hotel is brand new from the ground up and is a big step forward in gay travel to Berlin. Our room (delux superior) was small by US standards but very nice. Breakfast was great, (but expensive). Having the gym, sauna and hot tub on the top level was "priceless". Our service and reponse from the staff was quick and overall the week was great.

Reviews.Title: “Another vist, much improved service”
Reviews.Author: GLASGOWCHILL
Reviews.Content: Returned to Hotel Axel in January for a short weekend break. Originally had booked another hotel, as i am aware of how small the Axels standard rooms are. However two weeks before travel i found an unbelievable deal on one of their junior suites so snapped it up. Arrived late morning and was lucky to get straight into the suite. The suite this time was larger than during my last stay and was perfectly comfortable for a short stay. The storage space for clothes was tucked away out of sight meaning that the room always looked tidy as there was plenty of space to put bag etc. Sitting area as you came into the room was also ideal for leaving snow covered boots rather than having to walk into the main part of the room with them. The huge bathroom, although dark had a gret shower, bath, twin sinks and lots of towels. The hotel in generally seemed very quiet, hence the cheap deal on the suite. Very few people round and more often than not the only people sat in the bar were us! As previsouly mentioned this hotel is well located for the metro, literally 2 minute walk and also Ka De We, which has a great food hall and is a cool place to chill out and enjoy some lunch and people watching. All the staff at the Axel were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “An expensive triumph of style over substance”
Reviews.Author: hal9000Discovery
