Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Axel Berlin for 5 nights over New Year from 29 Dec 09. This new hotel is well situated on the edge of the popular Schoneberg gay district. The décor is modern and classy if you like lots of black and gold. Squeezing a hotel of this size on such a small site was clearly a challenge for the designers. The result has not been particularly successful in terms of how some of the rooms actually work. Our 6th floor City room cost a fortune and was so small that it could only be used for sleeping. Given this is supposedly a 4 star hotel, we were surprised our room did not include: • Chair(s) • Table or desk • Luggage stand • Kettle/ mugs/ tea or coffee • Minibar or fridge • Ironing board & iron • Wardrobe The room has a large comfortable double bed which takes up most of the floorspace. There is no headboard as there is a furniture unit behind. Circulation space in the room is approx 4 feet to the bottom and to one side only of the bed, which is almost hard-up against the external glass wall. This makes getting in and out of bed for the person on that side awkward. Also, the window cannot open properly as the foot of the bed is in the way. The extensive use of black décor in such a small room gave it a claustrophobic feel at times. There is no separate bathroom. Instead there is a shower space and WC compartment. The wash basin is more in the body of the room next to the clothes hanging/ drawer space. The shower space has an internal glass partition onto the entrance way – so if someone opens the door to your room when you’re in the shower, the view could be interesting! The clear glass shower door opens near the bed – so not much privacy when washing. There are not enough hooks/ rails for hanging bathtowels, so they have to be slung over the shower door making the room look untidy. The WC compartment is cramped and is in clear view of the bed. It has a flimsy sliding door which doesn’t afford much privacy if you’re sharing. We preferred to use the larger WC in the wellness centre across the hall. Temperature control in the room was not good – it seemed stuffy and warm regardless of whether the thermostat was set at 10 or 25 degrees. There are heavy black curtains on the window – no blinds. In summer, with the sun shining directly you’d have to keep the curtains closed and I guess it could get sticky. There was a background stale (bad drain) smell in our room throughout our stay. There is a narrow decked walkway outside the window with no fixed barriers to prevent someone from another room walking right by your window or coming in if you’ve left it open. Wireless internet was €9 for 24 hours – slow connection. Front of house service was dispassionate, and staff seemed more intent on looking glamorous than actually doing anything useful. Housekeeping was discreet and of a reasonable standard. The City room is billed as a double but would work best for single occupancy. If you’re a couple and intent on staying at the Axel, go for a suite – but it’ll cost you the other arm and the other leg. There are better Berlin hotels you could spend your money on than this one. Setting aside the stylish gloss, the Axel City room was one of the smallest most expensive and impractical rooms we’ve encountered. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting concept, awful management”
Reviews.Author: flyerdc
Reviews.Content: Nothing like its lovely sister hotel in Barcelona. Poorly managed. Bizarrely confrontational reception managers (just try to change your room to something nicer, and you'll be met with hostile disbelief from the women behind the desk). Interesting but odd interior design (the toilet could be seen from the bedroom, even when the bathroom door was shut; there was no place to hang a wet towel). The much-advertised spa was poorly serviced, with no supply of towels and an empty water fountain. The jacuzzi was kept luke warm, which defeated the purpose, and there was no interest at the reception desk in adjusting the temperature. Bad housekeeping; there were cigarette butts and an empty foil wrapper on the balcony throughout my stay. My only praise: the wait-staff in the restaurant, who were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: funkingr8
Reviews.Content: The Axel Berlin is a beautifully modern hotel situated in the Schoneberg area of Berlin, I stayed here during the Berlin Marathon and the staff were extremely helpful throughout my stay, providing directions, advising where the local U-Bahn (underground station) and ensured any enquiries where dealt with promptly. The rooms were comfortable and very chic. The area itself has bars and restaurants nearby and is only 10-15 mins by tube to the City Centre, definitely somewhere to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: fljohnny5
Reviews.Content: checkin went well. went we got to the top floor there was an odd smell in the hall way threw the duration of our 3 nights there. Also heads up.......the shower looks nice until you use it and water starts to flood the bathroom area as well as the carpet. We checked 3 times with the front desk because we couldnt even take a 5 min shower without water flooding the room. On our last attempt to have someone look at it i was told by the front desk person well how long are you showering for? (rather rudely) Never Again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, less than average service”
Reviews.Author: dmhinsf
Reviews.Content: This hotel has great potential if the staff could be more gracious, kind and welcoming. They treat questions or interactions with such cold sterility. I appreciate cultural differences, but if I am going to fly across the world and pay the price I paid for my suite, they should at least be kind and hospitable. The hotel location is convenient and easy to get to. The neighborhood surrounding is filled with restaurants and shopping opportunities - including KaDeWie - Germany's largest shopping center. There is also easy access to nightlife including the local gay scene. The room itself was quite nice and had a modern feel. There was a big garden tub which I found relaxing and a shower as well. The bathroom was roomy and had nice amenities. The room design was unique with a tinted window above the bed that looked into the bathroom. In the morning the light from the bathroom window would shine into the room through the window and wake me up. I could never sleep in. There was no way to cover the window. The property has a nice feature of a roof top jacuzzi, steam, sauna and gym. This area was quite nicely appointed and maintained. Definitely one of the finer perks of the hotel. The breakfast was nice and with rich, tasty coffee. Otherwise it was a buffet to cater to the tastes of travelers from various parts of the world. Again, the service was poor. The waiter I most often interacted with seemed to absolutely hate the clients (tourists) and hate his job. I had a nice enough experience - but mostly I am as indifferent as the staff. Customer service wins with me over the features of the property any day. I will not likely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some work”
Reviews.Author: gavinjsain
Reviews.Content: We booked a Superior room for our 1 week stay in Berlin. Once in the room we realised that there would not be enough room for us. No hanging space or room to store our 2 bags, it looked great but did not function well as a hotel room. Luckily we were able to upgrade to a Junior Suite. Much more hanging space and a lot more room. Although there is not really any space for bathroom bags or to hang your towels. The problems we had with the hotel came from the quality of service. There is a message system attached to the TV, each night at 6 pm the TV would switch on or switch over to show you the specials at the restaurant. So it would either wake us from a nap or turn our TV programme off. The front desk seemed to no nothing about this and I asked them to disable it from our room, which they obviously did not because it happened 4 times during our stay. One time it was like a fire alarm throughout the building just to notify us of the diner specials! It lasted 1 hour. During these problems no one at the front desk seemed able to explain what was going on or be able to apologise for the problem. The hotel has potential but needs to be run in a more professional manner. Most of the problems are easy fixes. This is not just some gay guest house, this is an expensive hotel and should be run like one. More staff training on customer service is needed to bring this hotel up scratch. I would not recommend this hotel to a friend unless I knew that service had improved. After having read some recent reviews it seems that some staff may need to be changed.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: LABToronto
Reviews.Content: Great place. Super Site. Buenos Aires suite was super (room 5160.

Reviews.Title: “Top location.”
Reviews.Author: Kees_ams
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed the young staff who were always eager to help me when I had questions (mostely) about the nightlife. The location of the hotel is ideal when you want to explore the city and all it has to offer, both day and night. Only had diner in the restaurant once because I wanted to explore the local culinary scene more but I had a very pleasant diner. Food was good and the serving staff was prompt, polite and helpful. Due to the good suggestions from the staff about the Berlin nightlife I had a trip I won't easily forget.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Experience I have ever had!!!”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkLad
Reviews.Content: My stay in the Axel Hotel Berlin was a very positive highlight during my stay in Berlin. The entire staff was more than just professional, they actually made you feel as if you were a member of their family. I was blown away by that. The room we had was small but perfect for our needs and perfect for the price. The restaurant was also a very positive surprise, friendly service, great food and excellent cocktails. Axel Spa was quite relaxing with a jaccuzi in the open!!!! And the massage treatment WOW!!!! And the location,almost like being in New York, we were in the middle of the city.. All in all i would give this hotel on a scale from 1-5 a 4.5.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Ingmar53
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Berlin, and we loved the Schoenberg neighborhood and its ample gay venues. The hotel is also very convenient to the U-bahn and around the corner from the wonderful KaDeWe Department store. The hotel is very stylish, clean and comfortable. The rooms are small and though well-designed, there is a bit of style-over-function going on here. There is very little room to hang clothes or store luggage, no convenient place to hang used towels and such. That said, it's a general good use of small space and the bed was very comfortable, and we appreciated the flat-screen TV and internet access. We booked through a pre-paid reservation service, and I still doubt that we got the "upgraded" room we had reserved. There was also some confusion when we checked out and were initially double-charged, but that error was corrected and we were notified when we got home and before we even noticed the mistake. Breakfast (not included in the rate) is over-priced, we think, and there are plenty of other reasonable options nearby. The bar/restaurant seemed rather deserted during our week-long stay, but it was early August.

Reviews.Title: “Dynasty meets bath house ... An experience to say the least”
Reviews.Author: interpolation
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located if you're a single gay male over the hill and looking for a convenient way to hook up with similarly aged gents. Not for my partner and I but we got huge kicks out of the "disturb me" sign one could put on the door handle and the amount of rather unfortunate looking men in bathrobes prawling the hall. As with a previous reviewer I agree the initial impressions begin the wear off. Alexandra, the pleasant front person upgraded us to a superior suite and we were impressed by the size of the room and comfort of the bed. The red plexiglass shower and sliding door to the toilet were not for the shy and I wouldn't bring a friend here unless I was very close with him or her. The location was a major let down; aside from the kudamm and kadewe nothing was in close proximity - lesson learned that Berlin is a huge, sprawling city. The young and hip parties are all elsewhere so if you're under 35 and not into gentleman suitors look elsewhere. The price was right but I wouldn't stay here again if I could find similar deals in more central parts of Mitte.

Reviews.Title: “Axel - Hetero Friedly but not so Clean Friendly”
Reviews.Author: ccgworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay here during a recent trip because I have stayed at their property in Barcelona before and had a good experience there. Not the case with Berlin. Albeit that the Berlin property recently opened in March 2009, they have had ample time to work out the kinks. PLUSES: conveniently located; welcoming and nice front desk staff; goodlooking design in common area and rooms; nice backyard common space; great bed and pillows; nice bathroom and toiletries. NEGATIVES: VERY bad cleaning standards! My friends each had the same complaint, from a thick covering of dust on surfaces to stains on bathroom floors and walls that went uncleaned/vacuumed for days. They also didnt change my sheets in 5 nights - longest I have seen is 3 days at other hotels! They only changed towels when you leave them on the floor (common among hotels today). But the pubic hairs on walls, splatter on side and back walls around toilet and unwashed flat surfaces like the desk are NOT acceptable cleaning standards. Also, the wifi signal is spotty at best (it costs 9 Euros for 24 hours and you have to eques codes for log in from the front desk). Breakfast is not included in the rate - there are cheaper local alternatives at local restaurants that were much better anyway. If you want room service, that is VERY limited to a few salads and 2-3 sandwiches. No in room coffee/tea. All in all, i doubt i would go back again. There are better designed and modern hotels in the area of Berlin that are lower rates (I know because I checked).

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: djvmax
Reviews.Content: The staff were great. Very helpful and friendly. Good location and the rooms were very nice. I was by myself, but thought wondered if the double rooms had the same...2 single beds pushed together. If you're after 'romance' you may want to check if the doubles are 2 beds together or 1 bed.

Reviews.Title: “Decent gay hotel, too quiet and not working steamroom. Sauna too hot (not in a good way)”
Reviews.Author: Dutchguy71
Reviews.Content: The hotel is trendy and modern. Staff is willing to help, however some attitude. We got an upgrade to a Junior Suite what we liked very much. Nobody brings you to the room, because of all the mirrors you have to be careful where to walk the first time you enter a floor. The bar is very quiet. The second night we stayed in the hotel there was a party, this was more busy but also not very busy. The Mochito we drunk that night was awful, one of the worst we ever drunk. The first night the Mochito was great! The first night the sauna was very cold (20 degrees celsius) the second and third day the sauna was too hot (120 degrees celsius), you could stay for 5 minutes in the Sauna. The steamroom did not work. This was already for a long time. We missed chairs at the sun roof. Although we had the most beautiful weather you could think of the roof bar was not open (folder says it's open till September). The chairs in the Spa area are limited. This is something we totally did not like. Neighbors can look into the sauna and whirlpool. The rooms are trendy. We could walk around in the room, via the bedroom to the bathroom, the dressingroom into the bedroom again. We loved the curtains and the glass wall between the shower and the room. It was red glass. The shower has massage buttons. You have to pay for wireless Internet. Although they say you have 24 hours Internet for 1 price, the Internet is not available for 24 hours and very, very, very slow! Good value for money, however lot of items to improve.

Reviews.Title: “Great first impressions start to wear off”
Reviews.Author: Explorador90
Reviews.Content: A decent hotel in a great location for gay travelers. The staff is generally helpful, but you can tell it's a boutique hotel. They are not set up to handle usual hotel standards. But generally ok. We stayed in a suite, which was generous with space. But if you're not staying with a partner, you better not be shy. Above the bed is a red tinted window into the washroom with the tub on the other side. The shower has tinted glass and no doors to the washroom. We called our room the bat cave. It's basically painted black with gold trim. Very Dynasty like. Whoever designed rooms didn't pay attention to function. And what's with the shower being level with the floor. Water would flow out - we had to put a little towel barge to prevent the water from going all over the place. I'd stay there again for the right price. We got a good rate on Expedia and the hotel matched it. So decent value for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Good gay base in Schoeneberg”
Reviews.Author: don't_fly!
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights with my partner. The hotel's in a good location: close to all the bars and gay life of Schoeneberg and easily accessible, although it seems quite quiet. We were upgraded to a junior suite, which was great, but wondered how small the ordinary rooms must be, because the suite was not that huge. The room was really nice, though, with the bedroom in a circular space with floor to ceiling windows all around, so you get a good view. The bathroom is great, with plenty of space and a fantastic shower, and separated from the bedroom by a transparent red screen. Problems were that there is a window in the bathroom with no screen or curtain over it, so when the sun comes up, it bathes the bedroom in ared glow that can wake you quite early. We had to rig up a makeshift arrangement with clothes hanging over it to block out the light. Other issues were that the jacuzzi and steam room and sauna were not as warm as they could have been. The place is almost empty too. I know this isn't the hotel's fault, but the bar never seems to have any people in it. Given that Berlin is a bit of a laid-back, casual kind of place, perhaps trying to create an ambience that fits this a bit more might entice people the few metres up the road to the hotel bar. Internet was unusably slow and quite expensive. Overall, though, a good stay. I'd maybe stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and Clean”
Reviews.Author: RussellKP
Reviews.Content: So they say this hotel is Gay....but if so it really doesn't make a difference. It was a large clean modern hotel that had a few extra nightlife guides around. Rooms SUPER modern and clean. Good location. Nice helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sydneytravelbug71
Reviews.Content: My partner and myself stayed at this hotel in July 09 for 4 nights. Overall I would strongly recommend this hotel. The staff could not have been more attentive and on several occasions when beyond my expectations. They were extremely helpful in assisting with tourist sites, restaurants and bars etc. When something minor was wrong with the window, someone was there within 5 minutes to repair it. Rooms are wonderfully designed, the only tiny complaint is little hanging space, but otherwise very stylish and spacious. The gym was (unusually for a hotel) well appointed and the steam room/sauna and jacuzzi just great. Great value for money (especially as we'd just left Paris). I would, without hesitation, stay there on any future visits to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Triumph of form over function”
Reviews.Author: GuernseyCatlover
Reviews.Content: The Axel Hotel is very smart and our room (a superior double) was spacious. However, there was definitely a feeling of form over functionin the bedroom, as there was no wardrobe or storage space to speak of. This wasn't a problem for us on a 2 night break but it could be if you were staying longer. Breakfast was nice but over priced so we only had it on one of the 2 mornings we were there and chose to eat at a nearby establishment on the other morning. All the reception staff were very friendly and helpful and spoke excellent English.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel & stay”
Reviews.Author: 1972j
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Axel Berlin for four nights in June 2009. The hotel is really a great find. We got a good deal and upgraded to the Junior Suite, which was very nice because it had a lot of windows. The room had everything you would need and was very large. If you are at all modest, however, you might be slightly put off by the see-through shower, but since I was travelling with my partner that was no issue for us. The bed was big and comfortable and the bathroom had a jacuzzi tub. (There is also a hot tub, steam room & fitness center on the roof). The hotel itself is in a great spot, in walking distance to a lot of bars, restaurants, and close to the U-Bahn (2 different stops). The staff was very friendly & helpful, and gave us some great restaurant recommendations. We've also stayed at the Axel Barcelona, and they are similiar in style and atmosphere, although the hotel guest age skewed a little older in Berlin than in Barcelona. If you get to Berlin, the Axel is a great choice, especially for a gay traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and stylish hotel, but quiet...”
Reviews.Author: boyadam
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had previously stayed at the Axel in Barcelona so when this Axel opened in Berlin we decided to book for 3 nights (Tues to Friday) in late May of 2009. As the hotel is so new, it is very quiet at the moment and there are a couple of teething problems but hopefully these will be sorted out soon. LOCATION - Excellent location within easy walking distance (1-2 minutes) to gay district and very close by to the second largest department store in Europe (Ka-De-We). Attractions are 10 minutes away on the underground. STAFF/SERVICE - Very friendly staff who were helpful and knowledgeable when we asked where to go for drinks in the local area. Some members of staff on reception were more chatty than others but on the whole they all spoke very good English. Look out for Pedro - he is very hot! ROOM - We stayed in a Junior Suite and we were not disappointed. We had a king-sized bed, flatscreen TV and sofa area within the 'living' area of the room and the bathroom contained a jacuzzi-bath and a spacious walk-in shower that had several settings including one where you could be hit by 3 streamd of water from the side - very interesting! The bathroom was a bit dark - the walls were painted black - and we thought that more lighting was needed. Also, the water streams out of the shower in to the bathroom if you turn it up to the most powerful setting. The room was large, clean and tidy with a nice view towards the road with Berlin's buildings in the background. WELLNESS - The top floor contained a gym area, sauna, steamroom and outside jacuzzi. It was fairly quiet most of the time which was great for us. We could relax in relative peace with no lecherous men around. The gym equipment was fairly up to date but the sauna and steamroom could be bigger. The outdoor jacuzzi was fairly cold (not even likewarm) which was a shame and you could tell it wasn't the best jacuzzi, unlike the one in Axel Barcelona. Neverthless, the fact that there were not too many guests was great as it was pretty quiet most of the time. FOOD/DRINK - A word of warning, do not eat in the restaurant. Breakfast was standard and was ok but go elsewhere for dinner. We ate in the htel restaurant one night where it was Spanish tapas and paella night. However, none of the miniscule dishes that were brought to or table were remotely Spanish and we got the feeling that we were being given leftovers from the previous day. Also, less than half the advertised dishes on the set tapas menu arrived on our table. Substitute 'treats' were given to us and the waitress didn't seem to be aware of any perculiarity! The bar is ok but it is dead at the moment - maybe the fact that the hotel is so new is a reason for this but it seemed a shame for such a trendy and cosy bar. If you want a trendy and busy gay restaurant, definitely go to 'More' around the corner on Motzstrasse - this is the best gay restaurant in Berlin by a mile. OVERALL - Not as efficient as the Axel in Barcelona but given time, it could be. The location is perfect, the hotel is clean and trendy and the Junior Suite was amazing. I'd definitely recommend this hotel to guys and girls of all ages who are interested in Berlin's nightlife as well as the many and varied attractions and sights.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at Axel Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Sexpotproductions
Reviews.Content: The Jacuzzi was cold. The internet didn't work. I called and asked for my "free ipod speaker player" and the guy said he was "too busy" to bring it or arrange for anyone to bring it to me. After going out that evening, I arrived back at the hotel, and the man behind the counter just looked at me from behind the locked sliding glass door. He threw up his hands in a "whatever" fashion. I dug out my Axel room card and showed it to him and he just looked back down at his desk. I couldn't believe it. I went looking around both sliding glass doors and found the thing I was supposed to slide it thru. When the door opened I went up to him and asked "Why wouldn't you open the door for me?" His reply was he didn't know who i was. When I originally checked in, the desk clerk asked me if I wanted a smoking or non-smoking room- I said smoking- then he said- he didn't have any. Why bother to offer a choice then? I stayed in Axel Barcelona once before and all was well there. But I will never stay at the Axel Berlin again- and I hope you don't either. There are SO many other cheap guesthouses and hotels in Berlin- The Axel is NOT worth it. Your only paying for "The Gay".

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TimHowlin
Reviews.Content: This was my second and third stay at the Axel in Berlin. On two separate nights, I stayed in two types of rooms, mostly out of curiosity on what they were like, and if they were worth the money. On one night I stayed in the nicest room the hotel offers, I think it was called the "Berlin Suite". At any rate, the room was nice, and was in the circular portion of the hotel, so it was kind of different and funky. The room had a separate sitting area with sofa and it's own flat screen TV. it also had a computer with "free" internet. (In other words, no separate charge for it, since you are paying twice what a regular room goes for). The Junior Suite was also in a circular part of the hotel, but without the sitting area and computer. but it also had a plenty of windows and a jacuzzi bathtub. The only complaints I had about the suite rooms, both types, were that they are all in the front of the hotel, so if you open a window, lots of street noise. And when I was there for this trip, the AC ws not on, so you either had to endure the street noise, or a very stuffy, hot room. The other complaint I would have about both suites is the shower is much smaller, since they include a jacuzzi type bathtub in both types of suites. (Though they only give you the free bath salts in the in big suite, no the junior suite for some reason). Also, a BIG complaint I have was that in both suites, the floor to ceiling window in the bathroom did not have a curtain! I know German's have a less of a hang up on public nudity, but I like a little more privacy when getting in and out of a shower! Overall, unless you are trying to impress a new "mate", stick with the standard rooms, and take the money you save and buy a nice meal. Still, A great hotel, in a great (gay) location.

Reviews.Title: “never more”
Reviews.Author: sibarita96
Reviews.Content: gay hotel ?? I think that axel ischanging, or something in happened. small rooms and the cleaning ..... personal in reception a little confused the breakfast is very expensive and limited. Lunch, i would prefer not to speak about lunch. no pool, hotel axel without a pool ????? hotel not very romantic, there are more, romantic and best hotels in Berlin. I think at this moment the axel hotels are not gay hotels like before, i think it`s only business hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Falls well short in comparison to Axel Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: JohnJamesNewcastle
Reviews.Content: If you've been to Hotel Axel in Barcelona you'll have high hopes for this new addition to Berlin. There was seven in our group, and having stayed several times at Axel Barcelona, we were expecting a similarly well run, professional establishment with charm, style, good service... and of course specifically aimed at a gay market. Unfortunately Axel Berlin did not live up to expectation. The black and gold themed decor has resulted in a rather bleak environment. It is not a pretty building and the rooms are fairly small. I stayed in a Superior Room and whilst the bed was a good size, the room was fairly small and the black bathroom very small. You will need to upgrade to a Junior Suite to get anything like the standard of one of the superior rooms in Barcelona. At 152 euros per night the room was fairly basic. Perhaps a little unfair to go as far as saying it was budget level but a fair way short of luxury. Yes, there was a mini-bar, but it was empty. The four coat hangers and 2 small drawers for storage are unlikely to accomodate the needs of any single traveller let alone the needs of a gay couple for a 3 night stay! Atmosphere was lacking in the bar and restaurant but with the hotel very quiet this may well improve with time. The roof top area is not yet finished and with no pool, there is only a jacuzzi tub for taking a dip. Lastly, the service needs some attention, particualrly in the restaurant which was really quite amateurish - nothing that couldn't be improved with a little training. It is obviously very early days for this new hotel, but certainly at the prices that we paid, we felt that we were sacrificing a fair amount of quality and service for the benefit of staying in a gay establishment. A shame... but do try Axel Barcelona. John (Newcastle).
